events.id: Beervana-Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy-WOAP
events.name: Beervana
events.venue: Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s boldest, hoppiest, and most delightfully weird beer festival. This is no ordinary tasting event, it’s a full-blown sensory adventure where brewers go wild, food gets fancy, and the unexpected is always on tap. 

Expect more than 60 breweries pouring over 300 unique brews—from hazy IPAs and fruited sours to beer cocktails and non-alcoholic surprises. 

But Beervana isn’t just about the beer. It’s a feast for all senses: think whitebait fritters from Boulcott St Bistro, Korean fried chicken, Mahurangi oysters. Add in live music, quirky brewery stands (yes, there’s a Best Stand vote), and unexpected entertainment and you’ve got a festival that you'll come away from with a greater knowledge of great beer, a belly full and plenty of fun memories with your mates.

events.id: The Love Ferry-Wellington Railway Station, Bunny Street-WOAP
events.name: The Love Ferry
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station, Bunny Street
events.long_description:
Interislander is docking onshore to bring burger lovers something truly special — The Love Ferry a spicy beef and pork patty with melted Kāpiti brie, caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket, truffle aioli, crispy Harringtons bacon and pickled jalapeños in a Poneke Bakery red brioche bun, with smoked paprika and sea salt sprinkled fries.
This gourmet tribute to the love of food is served straight from the iconic Interislander ship box. Back by popular demand, the Interislander pop-up burger truck is making waves once again, offering a taste of the Interislander experience without even setting sail.

events.id: 96 Originals-Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St-WOAP
events.name: 96 Originals
events.venue: Logan Brown Restaurant, 192 Cuba St
events.long_description:
Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

events.id: Club Tropicana-Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde-WOAP
events.name: Club Tropicana
events.venue: Beach Babylon, 232 Oriental Pde
events.long_description:
This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.

Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington.
No passport required.
The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair.

events.id: The Enchanted Ale Quarter-Little Beer Quarter, 6 Edward St-WOAP
events.name: The Enchanted Ale Quarter
events.venue: Little Beer Quarter, 6 Edward St
events.long_description:
Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.

events.id: Academy Prize for Visual Art-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Academy Prize for Visual Art
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.description:
A huge exhibition of national artists will be on display at Tākina in August.
Artists from every corner of New Zealand will be vying for a $25,000 grand prize.
The Wellington Sculpture Trust will mount a display celebrating 42 years creating and promoting public art in the city.
Finally, nine South Island artists sharing Netherlands heritage exhibit an irreverent show through a multicultural creative lens.
NZAFA President Wayne Newman says “Tākina is Wellington’s new heart of creativity, and we’re delighted to fill it with the vision, energy, and diversity of New Zealand art.

FINIS OMNIUM is back for the third year, this time bigger and better than ever.
Taking place over two hellacious nights featuring some of New Zealand's best metal bands, this is set to be a certified banger!
With two legends of the kiwi scene in Dark Divinity and MetalTower headlining the Friday and Saturday nights respectively, and with support from a gluttony of banger kiwi bands representing multiple sub-genres, these are two must-not-miss nights of carnage to satiate anyone's blood lust.

events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra.
Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods.
You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control.
Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat.
The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years.
The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025.
First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’.
Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’.

events.id: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand Symphony Orchestra 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists.
In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list.
At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO.
Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works.
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO.

Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented.

events.id: DILLI-24-Loretta, 181 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: DILLI-24
events.venue: Loretta, 181 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.

events.id: Santa Cipolla-Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St-WOAP
events.name: Santa Cipolla
events.venue: Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St
events.long_description:
“Holy Onion”. For the entire month, Cicio Cacio Osteria is getting brave and bold, celebrating the magic of vegetables in all their glory, especially the santa cipolla (aka the holy onion). 
Vegetables bring colour, life and joy. In Italy, they mark the rhythm of the seasons, stir up cherished memories and signal the excitement of fresh beginnings. Come along and experience vibrant flavours with playful snacks, fun street food, freshly baked breads, handmade pasta and a brand new range of dishes that celebrate the beauty, bounty and simplicity of Italian cuisine.

events.long_description: Executive Chef Jonny Taggart shares his love for the classic – and not-so-classic – flavours of Quebec. This special menu will feature everything from Tourtière (French Canadian meat pie) and smoked meat sandwiches to the beloved pairing of poutine with a steamie (Montreal-style hot dog), along with the sweet and comforting tarte farlouche. events.id: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters-42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2025 Big Breakfast & Charity Auction for Big Brothers Big Sisters
events.venue: 42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.description:
Join Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington and Guest Speaker Glen Denham on Friday 22 August at the Petone Club, Udy Street, Petone for a delicious buffet breakfast, exciting live auction, raffles and more!
Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s.
As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy.
His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.

events.id: Cheesy Lovers-Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay-WOAP
events.name: Cheesy Lovers
events.venue: Le Marché Français, 262 Thorndon Quay
events.long_description:
Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!
events.description:
Calling all cheese lovers!

Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.
Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers.

events.id: Le Petit Chef-Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Le Petit Chef
events.venue: Intercontinental Hotel Wellington, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
events.description:
InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.
Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients.
Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

events.id: August's Nomadic Speaker: Rachel Young-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: August's Nomadic Speaker: Rachel Young
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Rachel Young is a freelance graphic designer, traveller, and occasional van-dweller who’s spent the last few years navigating the messy, beautiful reality of creative nomad life.
For Rachel, being a ‘nomad’ has never been just about travel, but a mindset. Since leaving her home in the UK in 2019, she’s moved across the world, worked remotely from a van, taught graphic design in China, and rebuilt her creative career more than once.
Today, she blends her love of design with a passion for helping other creatives navigate the highs, lows, and mindset shifts of freelance life, while inspiring those around her to pursue their own dreams.
In this Friday's talk, she shares the unfiltered truths of freelancing on the move - from creative burnout to financial uncertainty - along with the mindset tools that can make the journey not just survivable, but meaningful and joyful.

events.id: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 200 Hour Vinyasa Yoga Teacher Training
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher.
We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.
Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge.
Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.
A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

events.id: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania-Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street-WOAP
events.name: Nyumbani: A Taste of Tanzania
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 6/100 Tory Street
events.long_description:
Journey through the heart of Tanzania with dishes that feel like home - comforting, bold, and full of love. This special five-course degustation is created by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, a baker who grew up in Tanzania and carries its flavours, traditions, and warmth in her heart. 
Whether it’s the warm embrace of coconut-infused stews, smoky grilled meats, or fragrant spiced rice, each course is a reminder of how food connects us. This menu brings authentic East African flavours to the table, reimagined in a modern way that feels like home. Each course is matched with a carefully selected wine to enhance the flavours of the dish. Expect generous hospitality and a setting that feels like stepping into a Tanzanian family gathering.

Each course is matched with a carefully selected wine to enhance the flavours of the dish.

events.name: Āhuru Kai Kōhua Poaka: Burger Wellington
events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.long_description:
The boil-up is a dish of love, traditionally made in big pots for whānau and friends. It brings people together. Te Papa wanted to capture the essence of this traditional Māori kai and give it a gourmet twist.

Traditional boil-up pork roulade, with Pagro lettuce and tomato, puha mousseline, and horopito aioli in a toasted Brezelmania watercress milk bun, with hand-cut kūmara fries, mānuka honey aioli, a shot of bone broth, and a heart-shaped raspberry framboise dessert.

Join us at the Te Papa Cafe on Level 1, walk-ins welcome. Reserve your spot by booking now.

Please note we aren’t able to accommodate dietary requirements.

events.id: Messengers-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Messengers
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025
events.description:
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals.
The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art.
It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century.
The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden.

events.name: Interislander: Pop-up Burger
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station, Bunny St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Interislander has been a long-time supporter of Visa Wellington on a Plate, the famous hospitality event that lights up the Wellington region each August.

The Love Ferry
Featuring a Poneke Red brioche bun, with a beef & pork patty seasoned with a mix of smoked paprika, garlic, and a touch of cayenne pepper. Melted Kapiti brie cheese with caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket and truffle aioli. Topped with crispy Harrington’s bacon and pickled jalepenos for those who like a little heat. Served with a side of crispy fries sprinkled with smoked paprika and sea salt at $20. For the perfect pairing, we offer a Garage Project Beer match for $12.

Pop-up Burger at Wellington Railway Station
We've set up a pop-up burger truck outside the Wellington Railway Station. This will allow the public to indulge in our burger and fries without needing to sail on the Interislander. Its also available to passengers when travelling the Cook Strait on the Ferry.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.id: TGIF: Blast from the past - Katrin Eickhorst (recorder), Corrina Connor (cello) and Michael Stewart-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: TGIF: Blast from the past - Katrin Eickhorst (recorder), Corrina Connor (cello) and Michael Stewart
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Katrin Eickhorst and Corrina Connor, both experienced baroque cellists, are challenging the perspective of the continuo assuming a servant’s role. This programme offers opportunity to “swap” parts, cello taking the upper part, recorder the bass line, both playing equal parts, and on their own. Michael Stewart joins with the missing harmonies, and an additional highlight on the harpsichord.
The programme culmination in Corelli’s “La Folia” gives a lively demonstration of equity between treble and bass parts.
Entry by koha

events.id: DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp 2025-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp 2025
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Kia ora DEBRA New Zealand whanau !
Save the dates - DEBRA NZ Conference and Family Camp, Wellington, Friday 22 - Sunday 24 August 2025.
We are very happy to announce that we are planning a get-together for the NZ EB whanau and a few Aussie families in Wellington in August. We really hope you can join us - it will be wonderful to see you!
This event is a great opportunity to meet other families, connect with old friends and make wonderful new ones, learn from each other and from valuable talks about EB issues, and have time to relax and enjoy a couple of days in Wellington city - the creative capital! We're keen to hear about any particular topics you would like to hear about.
Everyone is welcome including extended family and friends, caregivers, and healthcare professionals.
Dates: Friday 22nd August (check-in from 3pm with informal meet and greet from 5.00pm), to Sunday 24th August (finishing 2pm after a farewell lunch)
Event location: Wellington City, venue to be confirmed
Registration will be launched in early May - please stay tuned for further details!
Your registration fee will cover the conference, meals and children’s activities from Friday evening to Sunday lunch time, but it does not cover accommodation (amount to be confirmed), travel or airport transfers.
DEBRA NZ will provide some limited assistance with accommodation and travel costs if needed, subsiding flights for the person attending with EB.
Please contact debra@debra.org.nz if you would like to apply for this support.
There will be more information soon.
We need an idea of numbers so please get in touch as soon as possible!
Email: debra@debra.org.nz with any questions and let us know if you are interested in attending.
Nga mihi nui,
Anna, Lea and the DEBRA NZ team
debra@debra.org.nz

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: The Kava Experience-20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Kava Experience
events.venue: 20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!
Choose your journey:
* Mini Experience: $30 (1.5 hours)
* Full Experience: $50 (3 hours)
We can’t wait to welcome you!

events.long_description:
A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.

• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

events.id: Redacted- Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Redacted
events.venue: Dixon Street Te Aro Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
An exciting and immersive original production, Redacted is a bold devised theatre work created entirely by the Year 2 and 3 drama students.
Bursting with energy and imagination, this vibrant piece blends dance, dialogue, monologue, music, and abstract art to explore the current state of Wellington, the arts, and the shifting world around us.
Through a series of compelling vignettes and live art moments, the students reflect on their place within the arts landscape today, diving into themes of the universe, taonga, Superman, and freedom of speech.
Honest, dynamic, and deeply creative, Redacted showcases the extraordinary voices of tomorrow’s artists as they grapple with what it means to express themselves in a constantly evolving world.
Directed by Lyndee-Jane Rutherford and Gavin Rutherford

events.id: Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place-Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Altared States | Electronic Soundscapes in a Divine Place
events.venue: Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience.
Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.
Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.
Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:
August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers
Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.
Tickets are available from Wednesday 18 June, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.
About the Artists
Ludus
is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.
Stephen Gallagher
is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.
David Long
is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.
Jules Desmond
is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.
Oghum
is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.
Jess Chambers
is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”
The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien.
ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood.

This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.

events.id: ration the Queen's veges-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ration the Queen's veges
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.

events.id: Cringeworthy: The 90's-1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cringeworthy: The 90's
events.venue: 1A Taranaki St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!
Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene
Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.
The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).
On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.
In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!
What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!

events.long_description:
Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.
With headline act, Kura Forrester
Kura Forrester is an actor, writer and comedian, a face you have definitely seen on the telly including Kiwi shows such as: Golden Boy, Shortland Street, Super City and The Adventures of Suzy Boon.
Winner of the 2019 Billy T Award, Kura is fast becoming one of the standout comedian actors of New Zealand.
And MC Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.
Winner – Best Newcomer – 2020 Wellington Comedy Awards Nominated – Best Newcomer (Lower North Island) – 2020 NZ Comedy Guild Awards
Along with

events.id: Body Ocean-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Body Ocean
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.

IBrazza is Brazilian goodness on the dance floor at our favourite Wellington venue.

Music from 9:30

events.id: Arizona Flashback-Two Grey, 2 Grey St-WOAP
events.name: Arizona Flashback
events.venue: Two Grey, 2 Grey St
events.long_description:
Dust off the denim, dig out the flip phones and get ready to rewind time. Two Grey is bringing back Arizona Bar & Grill for a limited-time pop-up.

Welcome to The Arizona Flashback, a throwback to the late '90s and early 2000s that revives the flavours, energy and atmosphere of the iconic Arizona Bar & Grill. Known as a go-to spot for after-work drinks, late-night bites, birthday celebrations and casual catch-ups, Arizona was a place where people came together over great food and good times.

Now, its beloved Southwestern-style dishes and all-day menu return — not just as a delicious nod to the past, but as a celebration of shared moments, laughter and connection.

Immerse yourself in the full Y2K dining experience, complete with retro beats, neon lights and the return of Arizona’s famous Spin the Wheel game for a dash of playful nostalgia.

events.id: Lunch Speaker Series-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Lunch Speaker Series
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description:
Noble Rot invites you to enjoy a relaxed lunch in style. While away your afternoon with a leisurely three-course menu as they keep the wine flowing amongst you and your friends. They've lined up two incredible guest speakers at the forefront of the wine industry to entertain you with their stories, knowledge and insights into current trends in a relaxed but intimate atmosphere. You'll wish all learning was done this way. It’s the perfect excuse to treat your friends, your mum or your date.
 
Guest Speakers & Dates:

Saturday 9th — ‘Small Region, Big Sky’
Katherine Jacobs and her husband Jeremy embarked on a dream to produce some of Martinborough’s finest wines from their special vineyard in Te Muna, and they’ve achieved great success! Katherine will speak about upcoming trends, big dreams and hidden secrets in our favourite region’s wine scene.
 
Saturday 23rd — ‘A Rosie Afternoon’ 
Enjoy the company of Rosie Finn of Neudorf Vineyards, second generation of one of New Zealand's most prestigious wineries in Nelson. You’ll have the opportunity to ask Rosie all about current trends as she combines the story of her family winery’s historic roots and its impact on the landscape of New Zealand fine wines.

events.id: Planetary Parade - Free event-The Albatross Fountain, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Planetary Parade - Free event
events.venue: The Albatross Fountain, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki-Facebook
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki
events.long_description:
Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/
events.description:
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Choose from the following to enhance your day: A Deco Deep Dive The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history.
The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years.

events.id: Michelin Star to Martinborough-Union Square, 10 Memorial Square-WOAP
events.name: Michelin Star to Martinborough
events.venue: Union Square, 10 Memorial Square
events.long_description:
Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.

events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: Feed Your Senses-Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf-WOAP
events.name: Feed Your Senses
events.venue: Foxglove Bar & Kitchen, 33 Queens Wharf
events.long_description:
Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.

events.long_description: Step into a world of secrets for this one-night-only prohibition-style speakeasy, packed with live jazz, bootleg cocktails, and a dance floor ready for rebels and romantics alike. Slip past the watchful eye of the ‘authorities’ and step into a world where love is bold, the drinks flow freely, and the music never stops. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails featuring The Bond Store’s award-winning spirits, paired with decadent bites designed for sharing. But remember...loose lips sink ships, so keep the password hush-hush.

events.id: NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington-192 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington
events.venue: 192 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

events.id: Jewellery Making - Vintage Silver Charms-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Jewellery Making - Vintage Silver Charms
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
You’ll not only produce fantastic charms but gain essential silversmithing skills such as soldering, shaping and polishing, as well as learning top tips for how to create stunning and meaningful jewellery on a budget.
This workshop is ideal for both beginners and those returning to further develop their skills.
You can bring your own bracelet to adorn with the charms you make, or if you choose you can purchase one of our top-quality NZ made silver bracelets directly from the tutor in class ($25 cash please if you wish to purchase a bracelet).
bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Jewellery Making - Vintage Silver Charms-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery Making - Vintage Silver Charms
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Create your own personalised silver charms for chain bracelets!
You’ll not only produce fantastic charms but gain essential silversmithing skills such as soldering, shaping and polishing, as well as learning top tips for how to create stunning and meaningful jewellery on a budget.
You can bring your own bracelet to adorn with the charms you make, or if you choose you can purchase one of our top-quality NZ made silver bracelets directly from the tutor in class ($25 cash please if you wish to purchase a bracelet).
By the end of the course you’ll be able to: Design and create a set of 3 silver charms using fine jewellery-making techniques Use a jeweller’s saw to cut sheet silver into simple shapes Use jeweller’s files and sandpapers to refine silver forms hammers and steel punches to imprint letters, symbols and textures into sheet silver Use jewellery pliers to bend silver hoops and/or a soldering torch to connect charms to your bracelet Use polishing tools to shine and finish your silver jewellery creations Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.name: Saturday 'BAKES' By Onslow College
events.venue: Onslow College (School Grounds), Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Each Saturday, we offer a variety of sourdough products next to Onslow College. We always have doughnuts, but on Saturdays we offer bread, savoury baked items (this Saturday, we have brioche), and mini-celebratory sourdough doughnuts.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday morning through our website.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
EFTPOS is always available.
Our boxed mini-celebratory doughnuts, 70% of the original size, are available for a sale price of $25 for a box of all six flavours.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase all week. Contact Mark on 021 0223 0824 for next-day pickup.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
We launch a new flavour every two weeks and have created over 180 combinations since selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
If you are not following us on our social media channels, please consider doing so, as it helps the company grow and increases the exposure of our products. Thank you.

events.id: Aotearoa Tūmanako 2025 Children's Artworks for a Peaceful World.-34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Aotearoa Tūmanako 2025 Children's Artworks for a Peaceful World.
events.venue: 34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tūmanako 2025 is here!!
This is the 10th year of running Tūmanako, this year’s theme is: Nothing is more precious than peace
A community event encouraging young ones (under 18) to express their creativity and share their aspirations for a peaceful, inclusive, and nuclear-free world.
The exhibition will be hosted at the Waitohi Hub with an opening event on 22 August and the exhibition will be on display from the 23 August till13 September.
Come on down and spend some time viewing the art located on the lower ground of the Johnsonville library at Waitohi.

events.id: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish-100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish
events.venue: 100 Tinakori Road Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!
events.description:

events.id: Mahi Ready Day-7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mahi Ready Day
events.venue: 7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you job hunting at the moment? Are you fixing up your CV and not sure where to start?
Come along to Mahi Ready Day: A friendly, supportive, community-led event to help you build confidence and practical tools for finding work.
You can drop in any time between 10am and 2pm to chat with one of our helpful facilitators, or listen to a talk about career prepared-ness.
Everyone is welcome!
Timebank members can pay using time credits, and everyone else is welcome to contribute koha.
Workshops & stalls including (keep an eye on this event for more updates and a full programme!)
CV & Cover Letter help
Practice interviews
LinkedIn headshots
Style and clothing advice
Employment red flags to look out for
Online and tech support
Here's what's on (+more to be announced)
Here are some examples of what's on:
10:30am - 11.15am - Talk: Showcasing Your Strengths: Turning Skills and Experience into Employment
Job hunting can feel overwhelming, especially in this very tough market. This will be a relaxed, mana enhancing, practical session where you can ask questions in a safe environment. Angelique has hired people for over 30 years and will share insider tips on how to write a good cover letter, what makes a CV stand out and how to prepare for interviews.
11:30am-12pm - Talk: Employment red flags
Dhilum from Community Law Wellington and Hutt Valley will lead this session on what to look out for when it comes to employment, in particular for people in ethnic and migrant communities - including discrimination, unpaid wages and visa precarity.
12:30pm-1.10pm - Making a Living as a Freelancer
Roger has been working 'portfolio' for many years and prefers the freedom that this style of work provides. He has run workshops & coached 00's of people working in this way originally under the NEWORK Centre banner. He will share some tricks on how to find work & also to juggle several roles simultaneously.
10-11am & 1-2pm - Professional Headshots
Need a new LinkedIn profile pic? Starting a public facing role? Setting up a portfolio? David will be offering professional headshots and can make you feel at ease while taking a great photo of you!
10am-2pm - CV & Cover Letter Support
Get some advice and support on how to make your job application stand out in a crowd.NB: Bring a paper copy of your CV and Cover Letter, or make sure you can access it through your email account on one of our laptops.
10am-2pm - Practice interviews
Come and practice your interview skills with Lisa - a friendly, supportive face with years of experience interviewing job candidates.

CV & Cover Letter help Practice interviews LinkedIn headshots Style and clothing advice Employment red flags to look out for Online and tech support Here's what's on (+more to be announced) Here are some examples of what's on: 10:30am - 11.15am - Talk: Showcasing Your Strengths: Turning Skills and Experience into Employment Job hunting can feel overwhelming, especially in this very tough market.

events.id: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market-Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Threads & Treasures: Indigo Workshop + Market
events.venue: Thunderpants HQ, 42 Naples St, Martinborough
events.description:
Craft and recycle market including a drop in indigo dying business and other potential fabric design.
www.thunderpants.co.nz/ We’re a small, ethical, family-owned and operated company, based in the Wairarapa, producing New Zealand made cheeky goodness for your bum (and other areas) from regeneratively grown Australian cotton.
The Thunderpants story began in Nelson in 1995, when we were design students frustrated by irritating undies.
The challenge was on to create the ultimate comfy undie that wouldn’t go up your bum… Now, twenty years on, Thunderpants has grown to produce nearly 50,000 Thunderpants garments a year including kids clothes, swimwear, yoga pants, leggings, tops and camis.
Our focus has always been on producing underwear and clothing of exceptional quality and design using fun colourful prints and this ethos permeates all aspects of the clothing we produce.

events.long_description:
Step into "Your Friendly Neighbourhood Record Fair" hosted by On The Record!
Date: August 23 2025
Time: 11:00 AM
Venue: Ngaio Town Hall 1 Ottawa Road Ngaio
Calling all music lovers and vinyl seekers! Immerse yourself in a special mix of market energy and melodic sounds at this record fair designed for collectors in the suburbs. Uncover rare finds, hidden gems, and musical treasures in every groove.
Experience the excitement of sifting through crates filled with nostalgic tunes and timeless classics. Enjoy a lively atmosphere where music fans gather to honor the art of vinyl collecting, share stories, and spread the love for music.
Whether you are a veteran collector or a new enthusiast, this event has something for everyone.
Join us for an afternoon packed with music, memories, and the joy of discovering the auditory treasures of the past.

We will also have the amazing Grillhaus Food and Coffee cart on site!

events.name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers 2025 Post Matariki Season - Beginners
events.venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō Together we weave the mat for future generations Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes).
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako - Access to tools and harakeke - Harakeke is provided for your first two classes and then the tikanga is that you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself.
- If you are unable to harvest for class, we have a $20 ‘Please harvest for me’ option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
Important information - It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia - At our discretion tickets are fully refundable or transferable - For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you - If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class - We offer concession tickets for students, unwaged, seniors, and those with disabilities.
Teina - General - $25 Teina - Concession - $15 Teina - Koha - $7 Two Class Pass - Two back to back dates only: $50.00 Optional - ADD ON - Please harvest for me: $10 (10 rau only) after first two classes - 3 days notice required Note: Eventfinda fees apply Donations, Tax Credits and Corporate Gifting - We accept koha to support Ōtari Raranga Weavers via Shared Lines Trust.

events.name: Komebukuro Bag - Sashiko Stitching
events.venue: Hutt Art Society, 9-11 Myrtle St, Lower Hutt
events.description:
Description: Learn how to do 'One Stitch Sashiko' and turn your stitching into a Komebukuro bag (rice bag).
Participants will explore a range of different one stitch sashiko stitches in class then complete the panels at home ready to return and complete the bag construction in a second class.
The stitched panels could also be used to make pincushions and these are quick to make and make great gifts.
Wooden bowls for the pin cushion will be available to buy in class.

Every Saturday afternoon from 1-2.30pm with end of month performances.
$5 annual subs.
3 song books are provided each year at $10 each.
Koraunui Ukulele's objective is to turn members into seasoned performers by providing: - Weekly Ukulele, performance and stage skill practice sessions - Monthly performances with each member taking turns performing on front stage mic - After gig team photos - Regular team video uploads - Regular song writing projects The aim is to 'get a group going that could include people with zero experience and take them all the way through to performing'.

events.id: A Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: A Woody Fruit-fest - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this 60-minute downhill walk we will enjoy one of the legacies of Wellington’s previous summers, namely the large ‘smorgasbord’ of woody fruit structures. A close-up look at these structures will reveal a wide variety of mechanisms for fruit formation, protection, and dispersal.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Walking with Alpacas-Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Walking with Alpacas
events.venue: Cantharis Alpacas, 105 Waterfall Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Cantharis Alpacas offer guided walks with alpacas in the hills above the Kapiti Coast, conveniently located just 45 kms North of Wellington and just North of the new motorway.
During this unique experience you can learn about these beautiful creatures, and you will have ample time to meet, get close, walk, enjoy a cuddle and hand feed the alpacas.
On the way up and at the top you can also catch the stunning views of the Kapiti Coast, Kapiti Island, the South Island (on clear days) and beyond.
Ensure you have your camera ready to take photos and “selfies” of you and the alpacas.

events.name: The Parting Glass - Wellington Male Voice Choir
events.venue: Hobson Street Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us to fill your “Parting Glass” as we draw down the curtain on 64 years of male choral singing by the Wellington Male Voice Choir.
Our final concert will celebrate our rich and active history, drawing on much-loved favourites, and some new songs, that show off the unique qualities of male voice harmony.

events.id: 5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: 5 And Still Live ! - The Fifth Anniversary of Mouthfull Radio
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Five years ago we were in the midst of a global pandemic, visiting digital rooms with friends around the corner, making sourdough, and sort of watching the daily news. We were also making experimental attempts into the world of radio, with the birth of Mouthfull’s first international streaming server, playing music 24/7 (also live events a few times a week).
If we travel even further back in time, 2017 was the debut of the “Mouthfull Radio” episodic series (~20eps) - but we consider the ongoingness the real thing to celebrate.
Moving towards present day ~ through a vast richness of hosts, events, music, shows, zines, selectors, connections, pop ups, and story-times. It is a real joy to help community contemporary radio ripple out from this Pacific Island nation to the world wide web.

5 Years goes so fast, and so we shall honour this time with a great celebration in the capital city of Aotearoa! We will bring together all of the elements of Mouthfull you have known to love; make some books, make up some new dance moves with friends, and make our ears glisten in the sounds of live and selected music.
Whiro // New Moon. The last dark night of winter. A time for reflection; an invitation to come together as friends and whānau and plant intentional seeds for future flowers to bloom, as well as rest in deep listening and shared beingness.

Lineup:
*ºJuniper May
*ºStar Time
*ºajhoneysuckle (tāmaki)
*ºMystery Waitress (duo)
*ºDJ B.Lo (whākatu)
*°Benny Salvador


We are also releasing our first ever compilation. This special event will be opened with a premiere listening session of the full CD, playing the album all the way through. You can purchase a physical copy at the show, or on bandcamp (preorders open September 1st).
5PM sharp CD push play. Some divine collaborators with unique new releases on offer.

This is a fundraiser to support the sustainability of Mouthfull. We are only able to pay the bills due to events like this, and are fundraising to support a long awaited update of our digital infrastructure to enable future support. THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT - you can support us by purchasing a ticket (extra donation if you are balling), a tshirt, a raffle ticket, or a zine - it all goes to the same goal of enabling & uplifting one another.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.
