events.name: Soup & Solidarity
events.venue: 13 Garrett St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a relaxed, creative evening as craft solidarity books for both Ramallah (our sister city) and Gaza, to show our allyship from here in Aotearoa.
We’ll provide scrapbooking materials, but we encourage you to bring your own treasures. Items like stencils, photos, poems, and Aotearoa-inspired artwork are all welcome.
Join us to highlight shared culture through art, music, hopeful messages, and reflections on solidarity here at home.
This drop-in session continues the spirit of our Nakba Day gathering - connecting, reflecting, and expressing care. Expect warmth, soup, bread, tea, incense, beautiful music, and space to stay until late. This event is open to all ages.

It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.

events.venue: 172 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
S-ence returns to the Cuba St Tavern Courtyard with another lush audio offering for your mid-winter blues.
Two [Suite] Gallery Courtyard maestros that missed joining the Active Oasis at Cuba Dupa are back behind the S-ence decks.
Takas and Mish join Jen and Coda for a night of House, Nu Disco, Indie Dance, Techno and beyond.
Takas needs no introduction - this boy can play any where, any time, any how. It's going to be great to see him take the courtyard on an epic party journey as only Takas can.
Mish has graced the decks of S-ence and the Suite Courtyard and the Radio Active airwaves on the Housing Project and Late Late Breakfast Show. He's an old school and nu school house head, so get ready to dance.
Jen has been champing at the bit, having been DJing with the brakes on the last few sets. With a late set on the cards for this S-ence expect some heat!
Coda as usual will bring his bag of tricks to delight the dancefloor.
Make an evening of it and come for a late afternoon drink and repas (meal : ) and get into the groove when the beats start.
Early doors, early night.
S-ence feat:
Takas
Mish
Jen Kyle
Coda
Saturday 23 August - 7pm to 1am - $10 on the door
Lock in the date for your dose of sonic essence.
House through to techno and beyond.

events.name: The Early Bobs - Homage to Dylan
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Clayton Taylor and Nathan Torvik bring us The Early Bobs, their heartfelt homage to Dylan’s golden years.
Think harmonicas, blistering guitar breaks, and especially a voice that fans say “does Bob better than Dylan”.
From the Dust Bowl ballads to the biting protest songs, they’ll take you from 1961 to 1979 with authenticity, soul, and a whole lot of magic.
If you love Dylan—or just good stories wrapped in unforgettable tunes—these are your guys.
Believe me – this really is excellent stuff.

events.id: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The English Locust & Antü Mãrama Play The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
The English Locust is the folk/blues solo project of Wellington musician Jim Bailey.
The English Locust describes his sound as " Bob Dylan if he was goth", fusing the melancholy poeticism of groups like the Smiths and Joy Division with the musical stylings of folk and Delta Blues.
With his solo project The English Locust, he was a regional finalist in this years Battle of the bands, being the only soloist to make it that far in this years competition.
The group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mabudungun word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.
Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

events.id: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Saturday 23 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required. The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.

We’re turning Whisky & Wood into a dancefloor dressed in disco balls, house beats, and just the right amount of drama.
Come suited, styled, or somewhere in between. Just don’t show up underdressed.
What to expect:
DJs spinning house and disco all night
A photobooth for you and your best-dressed mates
A themed drinks menu (because boring drinks don’t match extravagant outfits)
Tiered ticket options depending on those who want more than an average night out.
Dress Code: Black tie - but make it fun.
Think sharp fits, fun colours and statement jewellery. Basically: your main character moment.
It’s winter. You deserve an excuse to feel hot.
Tickets
General Admission - $35
Access to DJs, photobooth, and drink specials.
Upgraded GA - $40
GA + a welcome glass of bubbly (because, main character).
VIP - $60
Not your average night. Includes:
Themed cocktail
Charcuterie cup
VIP wristband on arrival for easy drink redemption
Strictly 18+ event.
https://events.humanitix.com/the-dress-code

events.id: The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington-111 Wakefield St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Morning Shift - IS THAT US?! World Tour (sort of...) | Wellington
events.venue: 111 Wakefield St, Wellington
events.long_description:
After humble beginnings in a garage, to a record-breaking rise to the top of the podcast charts, Aotearoa’s favourite trio — Jordan Vaha'akolo, Brook Ruscoe, and Marc Peard — are taking The Morning Shift to the people. This August and September, they’ll be bringing eight massive shows across Aotearoa and Australia in their first-ever LIVE tour.
Real people, real talk and now real life. Expect all the stuff you love from the podcast: deep kōrero, big laughs, a few tears, spontaneous/questionable singing, plus whatever Jordan decides to overshare that night. The live show brings the podcast to life, with that signature Morning Shift energy that turns commutes into therapy sessions and takes gym workouts to another level.
Tickets go on sale Friday 4 July at Midday NZST.

events.name: Ritual Heaps / Field Enhancement / Loam
events.venue: 272 Taranaki Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ritual Heaps is psychic defence music. Durational synth fortifications from Whanganui/Te Awakairangi.
https://ritualheaps.bandcamp.com/
__
Field Enhancement draws inspiration from many different styles of music such as IDM, noise, drone, minuteless, psycore, techno and ambient. Much of the sound involves heavily manipulated and distorted textures, arrhythmic drums and scifi like synths, not keeping to any strict style or bpm.
https://acoldplace.bandcamp.com/track/glitchmylifeback
__
Loam, aka Daniel Cuzens, is a drone artist and guitarist in the heavy post-rock vein. Inspired by sci-fi film soundtracks they utilise synths to create enveloping and immersive sound worlds.
https://loamdrone.bandcamp.com/album/sonder-monolith

$17.50 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

events.id: The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond-18 Garrett St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond
events.venue: 18 Garrett St, Wellington
events.long_description:
From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses... The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'. Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone. Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.
----------------------------------------
Grab your tickets online from Under the Radar!
General Admission: $15 +BF ($20 on the door)
Students/Unwaged: $10 +BF ($15 on the door)
LIVE at The Rogue & Vagabond, Wellington - Saturday 23rd August.
----------------------------------------
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/ShakeemonDown

Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCX29VHaEGi9ZxRZX20aQIQ

events.id: Maille Sunday Kai-Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street-WOAP
events.name: Maille Sunday Kai
events.venue: Cuba Street Tavern, 172 Cuba Street
events.long_description:
Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.

events.id: Due Isole-Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St-WOAP
events.name: Due Isole
events.venue: Cicio Cacio Osteria, 167 Riddiford St
events.long_description:
Join Chef Giulio Ricatti for an extraordinary evening celebrating the bond between two islands — Sardinia and New Zealand. Through a carefully curated nine-course dinner, this event offers a personal and heartfelt exploration of identity, place, and the connection between land and sea.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries. Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.

Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence. The thoughtful combination of food and drink creates a dialogue between the two islands, offering diners a chance to taste the harmony of contrasts.

More than just a meal, this is an evening of storytelling. Chef Ricatti invites you to journey with him as he reflects on the places that have shaped his life and the meaning of finding a home across oceans. His philosophy of embracing the present moment is woven into every dish, making this event a sensory and emotional experience.

Whether you’re a lover of fine dining, an admirer of Sardinian culture, or simply curious about the connections between food and identity, this dinner promises a night of discovery. Step into the heart of two islands and savour their soul in one unforgettable evening.

Raised in Sardinia and now at home in New Zealand, Chef Ricatti shares his story through a menu that bridges the wild, untouched landscapes of both countries.
Each course is crafted exclusively with New Zealand ingredients, reflecting the rich bounty of our land and sea, yet inspired by the timeless traditions and bold flavours of Sardinian cuisine.
Accompanying the meal is an expertly selected pairing of wines from Sardinia and New Zealand, highlighting the unique characteristics of each region while celebrating their shared essence.

events.id: Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck-Manaia Rd, Masterton-Facebook
events.name: Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck
events.venue: Manaia Rd, Masterton
events.long_description:
Neil's Wheels presents the continuation of our Autocross. With Winter now here, we're switching to Tarmac on the back half of the Masterton Drag strip. So no rain delays!
This is the final Round of a 3 Round Rubber Duck Series and is a WMSA Kim Naylor Round!
Online entries via Motorsport NZ and are open!
If you don't have a Motorsport NZ Login, get in touch and we'll be happy to help you out, nearer the event time we will upload a form you can fill out.
Treaded tyres only, so semi slicks are okay. No full slicks!
Helmet and overalls requirements haven't changed for events of this level. Just make sure you're wearing cotton or wool under it, and leather shoes please.
To avoid any refuelling rule headaches we suggest you bring your car with enough fuel already in it. There is a few choices of petrol stations close by in Masterton.
No competition licence required.
Car club membership required unless this is one of your first two events ever.
Please follow official guidance when travelling over the drag strip, and do so at low speed and maximum care when entering the track.
The pits are our usual spot on the grass. We are not to use the concrete pads.
$60 entry plus to possibility of some lunch provided. Will confirm nearer the day.

events.id: Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening-Wellington Rowing Club-Facebook
events.name: Wellington Rowing Club AGM, Lotto 8’s & Season Opening
events.venue: Wellington Rowing Club
events.long_description:
The Wellington Rowing Club Annual General Meeting (AGM) and opening of the season will be held on Sunday 24 August 2024, 12 noon, at the WRC Function Centre.
We look forward to seeing you all at the Club at 9:30 for Lotto 8’s (weather permitting).
Following the meetings, a light lunch will be provided. This is also WRC’s opportunity to unveil the Function Space renovations to the membership.

Information about the AGM
The WRC AGM will commence at 12noon, in the WRC Function Centre. There will be provisions for online attendance.
At this year’s AGM, we have several board and committee positions that we will be seeking to fill. Many hands make light work, and we all depend on volunteers to keep the club growing and thriving. A variety of experience levels, skill sets, and perspectives are needed for a well-functioning club.
The positions to be filled this year are:
-Club Captain (2-year term, Officer role)
-Vice President (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Treasurer (2-year term, Officer role)
-Club Secretary (2-year term, Officer role)
-3 Committee roles (1-year term, non-Officer role)
-3 Board members (2-year term, Officer role)
Officers of the must consent in writing to being an officer and certify that they are eligible and not disqualified from holding office as described under section 36B of the Charities Act 2005.
The Club by-laws outline the current role descriptions, can be found here, note that the roles can be tailored to suit individuals’ skill sets and experience. Mentoring and support can be provided to develop individuals in these positions.
If you are interested, but have further questions- please reach out to the people holding the current role or any of the board or committee members to discuss.

events.id: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This two-day class is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes.
The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.

events.id: Art of the Bloom-Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Art of the Bloom
events.venue: Ventana Creative Collective, 8 Kitchener St, Martinborough
events.description:
Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower—a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand.
It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!
), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.
Date & Time: Sun 24th Aug - 10am-1230pm Location: Ventana Art Space 7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough

events.id: KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow-34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: KOHA SUNDAY YOGA - Heated Flow
events.venue: 34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us EVERY Sunday for a 90 minute Heated Flow for koha entry (ie, give what you can)! Proceeds are donated to a different charitable organisation each month that's committed to supporting the wellbeing of Aotearoa!
This weekly class is open to everyone, regardless of yoga experience - haere mai!
BYO mat or hire for $2; towels available for $3 and make sure to bring a big water bottle!
To book: Download the AWHI app to view the timetable, or simply show up in good time on Sunday!
WHAT IS 'KOHA'? Koha loosely translates to 'gift' or exchange. In other words, pay what you can for the class!
For more information about our studio, visit our website at awhiyoga.co.nz
events.description:
Proceeds are donated to a different charitable organisation each month that's committed to supporting the wellbeing of Aotearoa!

WHAT IS 'KOHA'?
Koha loosely translates to 'gift' or exchange.
In other words, pay what you can for the class!

events.id: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sea Glass Rings - One Day Jewellery Making Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures.
Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.
If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back.
Techniques: - Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’ - Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal - Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal - Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces - Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces - Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery Project : 1 Ring with sea glass (silver, brass and copper options) Materials: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver One hour lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.
Daylong workshop options on either Sunday 20 July or Sunday 24 August.

events.id: The Art of the Bloom- Make a Giant Flower-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Art of the Bloom- Make a Giant Flower
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower- a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand. It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.
Date & Time: Sun 24th Aug | 10am-1230pm
Location: Ventana Art Space
7 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
Price: $90

events.name: He Kura Toi Tangata: Gold Card Tour
events.venue: 3 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum invites our golden folk to experience an intimate, guided tour of photography exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
The tour will continue throughout the museum, weaving through Wellington stories and taonga currently on display.
After the tour, we’ll sit down for a chat and a warm cuppa in the old Harbour Board room, with a little sweet something to finish off the afternoon.
This tour is part of the Takurua Hauora: Winter Wellness event series developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
Tickets are limited. Booking is essential.
Note: International visitor admissions are not included.

Sunday 24 August | 10:30am–12pm
$5 for SuperGold Card holders

Book online or over the phone on: 04 472 8904
Image: Ngāi Te Rangi kuia in attending the hearing of the urgent claim concerning the use of te reo Māori in the public service. 2024. Wellington. Image credit: Tessa Chrisp.

Our Intro to Self Defence workshop is designed for anyone who wants to learn effective defensive skills and escapes from grabs and holds.
Our Intro to Self Defence workshop is designed for anyone who wants to learn effective escapes from grabs and holds as well as simple self defence skills that could save your life.
We encourage parents and children to do this workshop together so you can reinforce the learning at home. You get to benefit from the skills Sensei Patricia has gained from over 40 years training in karate delivered to you in a fun package!
You will learn how to:
- Stay safe
- Build awareness and confidence
- Defend yourself effectively
Cost: $29
NOTE: Family concessions available on request to patricia@familyfitkarate.co.nz. Ask about our gift vouchers for our Self Defence workshops and Karate memberships.
Time: 12:15PM to 3:15PM.

events.id: Breaker bay Raranga-150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breaker bay Raranga
events.venue: 150 Breaker Bay Rd, Breaker Bay, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

events.id: Manawa Karioi Working Bees-7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Manawa Karioi Working Bees
events.venue: 7 Danube St, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our track maintenance and planting working bees are focussing on plant species diversity rather than large planting quantities. We have ordered 500 special trees from the Berhampore Nursery. We are in this for the long haul and a forest that contains a wide range of plant species will, in turn, attract a wider range of birds, lizards, and invertebrates. A wider range of plant species also allows for the forest to naturally regenerate and helps prevent weed species from establishing.
Tools are provided, bring sturdy shoes and a water bottle, Working bees are held every Sunday in June (except June 1st - Kings Birthday Weekend) and August 2025.
Meeting at the Information Shelter in the Tapu te Ranga Marae car park at the end of Danube Street in Island Bay. Children are welcome with parents or guardians.

events.id: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop-The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: House Candle Holder Clay Workshop
events.venue: The Art and Living Space, 17 Bradey Road, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
A fun, relaxing and creative workshop to make a magical clay house which can be used with real or fake candles.
We will use my hand drawn templates, white clay, slab building and modelling techniques, and imprint with fabrics to produce stunning clear glazed white houses.
Also includes the option of adding some dashes of colour accents using underglazes and coloured slips.
I love making houses!
You can add birds, cats, window boxes or whatever inspires to your creation.

events.id: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment!
The course starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm-5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver.
An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.
Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

events.id: Kids Rock 4 Palestine-9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kids Rock 4 Palestine
events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kids Rock For Palestine
One Day. One Stage. One Cause.
This event is organised by kids in Pōneke to raise funds for kids in Palestine.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
This isn’t just a concert, it’s a movement. Under-18 musicians, solo artists, and bands (some joined by over-18 allies) are coming together to rock out with purpose, showing that music knows no borders and compassion has no age limit.
These young performers are using their talents to stand in solidarity with kids just like them who are living through unimaginable circumstances.
Organiser Eddie 12: "We see children in Palestine who are being bombed and shot and are starving. We kids want to help. So that is what we are doing."
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.
100% of proceeds go directly to emergency aid and child-focused relief in Palestine - Convoys of Good and Kiwi Trust for Palestinian Childrens Relief.
Witness the next generation of artists and activists sharing the stage and raising their voices. Please support them with your attendance. Show them young people can make a difference.
Be part of an event where music becomes action, and community becomes change.
Do you want to volunteer to help? Email aotearoa2gaza@gmail.com
ALL UNDER 18s MUST ATTEND WITH A PARENT OR GUARDIAN.
events.description:
Kids Rock For Palestine One Day.
One Stage.
Join us for a one-day-only music fundraiser where young voices take centre stage to amplify hope and raise money for children in Palestine.
We kids want to help.
There will be stalls and crafting available for kids attending - Please come and support so we can raise money for Gaza's families.

events.name: Taste of Croatia: Fritule on Sun 24 Aug
events.venue: 32 Hania St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come along this Sunday 24 August at 2-4pm to enjoy fritule, a traditional Dalmatian festive dessert, often cooked at Christmas.
Fritule are one of the most requested recipes we’ve had for Taste of Croatia, so come down this Sunday when Danica Rudelj will be sharing her recipe!

The event picture is of Jamie Oliver’s version.
Let Dave Guerin know if you’re coming to the 24 August session at dave@ed.co.nz or 021 404 334.

events.id: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine-Martinborough 5711, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Huntress x A Lady Butcher : Whole Hog Workshop + Wine
events.venue: Martinborough 5711, New Zealand
events.description:
What to Expect: Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

events.venue: Texas Street Martinborough, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
Top of the fruit tree to-do-list at this time of year, is to check your fruit trees for health and vigour before they get going again in spring.
With that knowledge in hand, you'll be able to decide whether or not your trees need compost or mulch and whether to prune them now or in summer.
I'll show you how to prime them for the season ahead and set the scene for good health - get out ahead of pests, disease and poor vigour - its way easier and a lot more fun!
Coffee + tea + home baking for sale from 2.30.
Talk starts at 3.

events.id: Lady Butcher X Huntress Workshop-Martinborough, Martinborough, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Lady Butcher X Huntress Workshop
events.venue: Martinborough, Martinborough, Martinborough
events.description:
What to Expect: - Huntress Experience: Guided by "The Huntress", Jannine Rickards, a passionate advocate for sustainable living and wild wine, you’ll be introduced to a deep, meaningful connection between the land, the food we consume, and the wines we enjoy.
Alongside her teachings, you’ll discover how Huntress Wines reflect indigenous food-growing practices and how each bottle celebrates the connection between the land’s cycles and the wines that grow from them.
- Wine Pairing: As you absorb all the knowledge from the Huntress and Butcher, you’ll enjoy expertly paired wines throughout the experience.
Huntress Wines have been carefully chosen to complement each stage of the workshop, with a focus on organic, terroir-driven bottles that reflect the spirit of the land and match exquisitely with the charcuterie selection prepared.
This is a one-of-a-kind workshop that celebrates sustainable practices, the art of butchery, and the symbiotic relationship between the food we eat and the wine we drink.

events.id: Tony Yan Tong Chen-Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Tony Yan Tong Chen
events.venue: Waikanae Memorial Hall, 7 Pehi Kupa St, Waikanae
events.description:
Born in Auckland, Tony Yan Tong Chen has performed throughout New Zealand, North America and Europe.
Winner of New Zealand's Wallace International Piano Competition in 2019, Tony has since been placed in a number of other International competitions.
His Waikanae concert will open with Beethoven's concise Opus 90 Sonata.
A delightfully playful Chopin Waltz then introduces Chopin's great Bb Minor Sonata - the one frequently known as "the Funeral March Sonata" and considered to be one of the greatest piano sonatas ever written.
The next part of the concert will be devoted to the music of Alexander Scriabin, a Russian composer whose early music was greatly influenced by Chopin.

events.name: AGM - Annual General Meeting
events.venue: Percival Road, Paraparaumu Beach
events.long_description:
This is to formally advise all members of the upcoming Annual General Meeting (AGM) of the Kapiti Softball Club.
Details of the AGM are as follows:
Date: Sunday 24 August
Time: 4.00pm
Venue: Te-Atiawa park, Clubrooms
In line with our Club’s constitution, this notice is being provided at least three weeks in advance of the meeting. A formal agenda, the Annual Report, and Financial Statements will be available on the day, and will be made available on our website after the AGM.
If you wish to submit any remits or notices of motion, these must be received in writing by the Secretary no later than Sunday 17 August 2025.You can send these to info@kapitisoftball.co.nz
Committee Vacancies
This year, several current committee members have indicated they will not be standing again. While all roles are open to nominations and elected at the AGM, we especially want to highlight the following upcoming vacancies:
• Treasurer
• Club Captain
• Junior Convenor
This is a big change for our club, and we encourage any members who are interested in helping shape the future of our club to consider putting their name forward. If you'd like to learn more about what's involved in any of the roles, feel free to reach out for a chat.
Quorum Reminder: As per our constitution, at least 10 members must be present for the AGM to proceed, so we would greatly appreciate your attendance and support.

This August 24th join alt-folk songwriter Greta O'Leary & Te Whanganui a Tara artist Goodnight My Darling for one intimate and special show at San Fran, performing new and recently released works in celebration of emergence and O’Learys debut record 'River Dark'.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington-65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Jewellery-making in 4 weeks on Sundays, Mixed levels - Wellington
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This Sunday afternoon block is a short course on jewellery-making. It starts on Sun 24 August and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 14 September, 2pm - 5pm.
Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.
These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped warm studio!
Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this
Course fee $280, Early bird pricing $252 till 27 July.

events.id: Terry Shore-The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Terry Shore
events.venue: The Undercurrent, 118 Tory Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Terry Shore has been a real stalwart around the local Wellington music scene for over 30 years, playing his own original music both solo and with the Volun Terry Band.

He has 5 albums, 2 more on the way, and 3 EP's to his credit since releasing his first Poly Rhythm album in 2010. For the last 20 years he has run a programme on Wellington Access Radio showcasing unknown songwriters called Terry's Songwriters Show which airs on Saturdays at 2:30pm.

Terry has written memorable original catchy pop songs such as Anything, Dancing On The Line Island Love, Galactica Calling, The Daleks Are Coming In and many more.

He will be playing at the Undercurrent on Sunday 24th August from 5:30pm performing his originals with electric acoustic guitar and MP3 backing tracks. Stay on after the Sunday Jazz and see Terry for a good entertaining show!

Sunday 24th August
5:30pm
$15 online/ door
$20 for entry and CD

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

events.id: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan-St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: The Zimmermans play Bob Dylan
events.venue: St Peters Village Hall, Cnr Beach Rd and Ames St, Paekākāriki
events.description:
Join Aotearoa's pre-eminent Bob Dylan tribute band for a night of rollicking rockin' folkin' funkin' songs from the Bobster - recognised as one of the worlds greatest songwriters.
We have 2000 plus songs to choose from so no - we're not doing them all, just a selection of his greatest hits, some deep cuts into obscurity, and ones we think are worthy of an airing.
Our ten piece band is packed to the gunwales with drums, guitars, brass section, singers, and keyboards to replicate the sound of the man, but also provide our own interpretations of some songs.
Our band members come from all manner of musical outlets, from the Mockers and Let's Planet to the Balkanistas and the Wooden Box Band.
Don't think twice, Lay your lady lay down and get your ticket now cos - y'know This Wheel's on Fire and there ain't no stoppin' the Dylan train.

events.name: Gong Bath at Lotus Centre, Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
*Limited door sales for $25* *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

events.id: The Life of Henry the Fifth-1 Kent Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Life of Henry the Fifth
events.venue: 1 Kent Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Victory or ruin rests on his shoulders, yet his newfound power isolates him, leaving him lost, uncertain, and deeply unsettled.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past. It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
With only ten dynamic performers, this is Henry the Fifth like never before: stripped back, sharp, and driven by the raw intensity of Shakespeare’s text.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.
Full show duration: 95 min including a 15 min intermission.
“This production epitomises what can be achieved when talent, teamwork, hard work, opportunity and passion combine.’”
NZ Herald on The Tragedy of Macbeth
events.description:
A young man, once revelling in freedom and reckless camaraderie, is thrust into the role of a king, burdened with the fate of England.
Betrayed by friends, mistrusted by his men, and taunted by those who seek his downfall, Henry’s journey is both severe and profoundly relatable.
Shakespeare crafts a world where soldiers fight without knowing why, where the battlefield sees vagrants and children stand shoulder to shoulder, where uncertain rulers navigate a landscape devoid of guidance from the past.
It is a world that, despite its historical setting, feels unnervingly close to our own.
Expect fast-paced storytelling, immersive staging, and a production that puts the audience at the heart of the battle.

events.id: Sconnoisseur-Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy-WOAP
events.name: Sconnoisseur
events.venue: Pravda Café and Grill, 107 Customhouse Qy
events.long_description:
Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.

events.id: Next Gen Cook Off-LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St-WOAP
events.name: Next Gen Cook Off
events.venue: LTD., Level 1, 60 Dixon St
events.long_description:
The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.

Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.
Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in.
Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft.
At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

events.name: FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

events.id: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG- Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Leadership Unlocked: collaboratively solving complex school challenges -WLG
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a one-day workshop designed to elevate your leadership skills by delving into complex problem-solving and equity-focused educational strategies.
Developed and led by Dr. Jacqui Patuawa and Distinguished Professor Emeritus Viviane Robinson, this workshop builds on your existing expertise in leading learning, focusing on the use of double-loop thinking to address underachievement.
As Mumford et al. (2000) stated, “effective leadership behaviour fundamentally depends upon the leader’s ability to solve the kinds of complex social problems that arise in organisations.” In this session, you will: Build trust and foster respectful dialogue.
Accurately identify and analyse challenges affecting student outcomes.
Develop effective solutions that promote equitable educational success.

events.id: XTrail Spring - Skyline Scramble--41.276183, 174.755357-Facebook
events.name: XTrail Spring - Skyline Scramble
events.long_description:
The Skyline trails deliver a signature Wellington run — native bush, panoramic peaks, and rolling ridgelines. All 3 courses begin in the lush surroundings of Otari-Wilton’s Bush, New Zealand’s only native botanic garden, and wind their way up to the summit of Johnston Hill. The short course offers a rewarding climb and scenic descent, while the long course adds a little extra vert and extends your adventure along the iconic Skyline Track, with sweeping views over the city, coast, and beyond. With flowing trails and plenty of natural beauty, it’s a proper taste of Wellington’s wild backyard.
https://barefootxtrail.co.nz/

events.id: Glimmers of Gold | Embroidery by Jo Dixey-Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Glimmers of Gold | Embroidery by Jo Dixey
events.venue: Old St Paul's Cathedral, 34 Mulgrave St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A gorgeous new exhibition pops up in Old St Paul's vestry this September featuring 79 hand embroidered golden humans.
Embroiderer Jo Dixey is constantly fascinated by the short interactions we have as humans that leave us with calm or happy feelings; feelings that can last for the rest of the day or sometimes much longer.
'This can be sharing a smile with a stranger on a beautiful day or even in the rain, chatting with people in a long queue, collectively watching a great movie. Being open to these moments enhances our lives and the lives of those around us,' Dixey says.
'In psychology, these tiny moments that stimulate positive feelings are called glimmers.'
Gold is a chemical element with the symbol Au and atomic number 79.
'Welcome to Glimmers of Gold.'
About Jo Dixey
Dixey is a Royal School of Needlework trained embroiderer. She teaches small groups a variety of embroidery techniques, works on commissions which have included large altar cloths, university banners and work for the fashion and movie industries, and repairs old embroideries. She holds exhibitions of her embroidered pieces every few years.
In 2017, Dixey published her first book Stitch People, which was later re-released as Creative Thread.
Her work is held in private and public collections in New Zealand and overseas.

events.id: Art and AI: Brit Bunkley in Conversation with Megan Dunn-Alexander Turnbull Library, Aitken St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Art and AI: Brit Bunkley in Conversation with Megan Dunn
events.venue: Alexander Turnbull Library, Aitken St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Artist and filmmaker Brit Bunkley discusses the pragmatics and politics of making art with AI. Join us for a discussion in the Gallery, with insights into the making of his latest work Archive, commissioned for Messengers.
--
Brit Bunkley is a New Zealand-based artist and videographer whose practice spans sculpture, installation, and digital media. A recipient of the US National Endowment for the Arts fellowship, two NY state grants, and the Rome Prize Fellowship, his work explores the intersection of physical and virtual spaces, often blending surreal imagery with themes of history, politics, and environmental concerns. He has exhibited at the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa and internationally at Rencontres Internationales Paris/Berlin, FILE São Paulo (including 2025), and the Athens Digital Arts Festival. Recent exhibitions include Visions in the Nunnery, London (2022), Cybersculpture 2024 at Collège des Bernardins, Paris, and The Torrance Art Museum, LA (2025). In 2024, he won Best Art | Experimental Video/Film at the New York City Independent Film Festival. His work continues to evolve, embracing new technologies and alternative methodologies to challenge perceptions of reality and imagination.

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Anna Jackson and Rachel O'Neill
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
Nina Mingya Powles calls Anna Jackson’s Terrier, Worrier ‘a remarkable and playful book on language, anxiety, poetry, and the strangeness of being a person’.
Somewhere between a diary and a collection of poetic essays, it takes Jackson’s work into previously uncharted territory.
Equally off the charts is filmmaker, writer, and artist Rachel O’Neill’s Symphony of Queer Errands, a delightfully riotous musical fantasia and an irreverent ode to queer joy.
Chris Price will pilot the conversation between these adventurous voyagers in unknown seas.
Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre, Meow and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day and supported by the Letteri Family.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.name: Jess and Cam
events.venue: The Hop Garden, 13 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.
Tickets $20 or $10 for Capital Blues Inc members.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.
The Underworld, Pirie St, Wellington

events.id: Pride in Place: creating a community walk tour-18 Buckle St, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Pride in Place: creating a community walk tour
events.venue: 18 Buckle St, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join the team from Walk Tours NZ for a free and inspiring presentation on how to create and run your own non-profit community walk tour.
Over the past seven years, Walk Tours NZ has delivered more than 100 community tours around central Wellington, focusing on the city’s rich LGBTQIA+ Rainbow heritage.
This event goes behind the scenes of creating a walk tour and is perfect for anyone passionate about bringing place-based history to light – whether it’s Rainbow histories or a topic of your own choosing.
Hosts Roger Smith and Gareth Watkins will guide you through the key ingredients of a successful non-profit walk tour – including identifying interesting stops, crafting compelling narratives, and being an engaging host – even if you’ve never done it before!
The presentation will cover both traditional methods of researching and writing, as well as demonstrate some off-the-shelf Artificial Intelligence applications that can help support your storytelling.
Bring your curiosity, enthusiasm and ideas, and discover why walk tours offer a unique form of living history – and how the experience can build community and connect people. No previous walk tour experience is necessary, and all are welcome.
The Queen Elizabeth II Pukeahu Education Centre (formerly the Home of Compassion Crèche) in Pukeahu Park has limited space, so registration is essential.
Please register here: https://walktours.nz/book
This free community event is part of the Aotearoa Festival of Architecture 2025, organised by Walk Tours NZ in collaboration with the New Zealand Institute of Architects (Wellington Branch).
events.description:
Join the team from Walk Tours NZ for a free and inspiring presentation on how to create and run your own non-profit community walk tour.
Over the past seven years, Walk Tours NZ has delivered more than 100 community tours around central Wellington, focusing on the city’s rich LGBTQIA+ Rainbow heritage.
Hosts Roger Smith and Gareth Watkins will guide you through the key ingredients of a successful non-profit walk tour – including identifying interesting stops, crafting compelling narratives, and being an engaging host – even if you’ve never done it before!
The presentation will cover both traditional methods of researching and writing, as well as demonstrate some off-the-shelf Artificial Intelligence applications that can help support your storytelling.
No previous walk tour experience is necessary, and all are welcome.

events.id: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk-Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk
events.venue: Begonia House, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.
Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.
This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.name: Read to Kurī
events.venue: 34 Moorefield Rd, Johnsonville, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us and our doggy guests from Canine Friends Pet Therapy for Read to Kurī at the library. You can book a 15-minute session to sit with one of our friendly dogs and read your favourite book, or one you've found at the library.
Read to Kurī aims to help children improve their literacy, self-confidence, and self-esteem in a relaxed, non-judgemental environment. This programme is perfect for tamariki aged 5+ who would like to practice their reading skills while making a new canine friend at the library.
To book your session, please call the library on 04 477 6151, or email johnsonville.library@wcc.govt.nz with your preferred date and time.
Bookings are for 15 minutes only. After you have booked, library staff will be in contact informing you what time to arrive for your session.

events.id: Great Sounds Great festival 2025-96 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Great Sounds Great festival 2025
events.venue: 96 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Eyegum Music Collective presents GREAT SOUNDS GREAT, a multi-venue music and arts festival taking over Pōneke's Cuba Street precinct for one night only on Saturday 6 September 2025. Showcasing 40 of Aotearoa's best artists across 10 neighbouring venues, this is one big party you shouldn't miss.
Eyegum has worked hard to curate a programme that is sure to offer something for everyone, from first time gig-goers to seasoned live music obsessives. The eclectic lineup includes perennial indie maestros The Bats, capital hometown heroes The Phoenix Foundation, hip hop superstar JessB, troubadour-turned-party starter Anthonie Tonnon, captivating genre-bender Reb Fountain, the incredible local-by-way-of-Naarm Jen Cloher, plus a selection of up-and-coming artists handpicked from Eyegum's Free Wednesday weekly showcase series, and everything in between. There will also be plenty more to be announced soon.
Excitingly for 2025, we will be adding three new venues: St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records and 13 Garrett Street (sponsored by Radio Active), as well as a travelling electronic stage curated by Tonic Collective. This means more artists and music to experience in a variety of special and unique spaces throughout the night.
Ticket holders will receive a wristband that will give them access to each of the participating venues throughout the event. Information on how to pick up wristbands will be provided to ticket holders closer to the time.
Tickets are on sale now at eyegum.co.nz/great-sounds-great
When: from 4pm Saturday 6 September 2025
Where: San Fran, Meow, Valhalla, Rogue & Vagabond, Bedlam & Squalor, Hotel Bristol (2 stages), St Peter's on Willis, Flying Nun Records, 13 Garrett St
Who: The lineup will include Anthonie Tonnon, Baby Zionov, Bad Taste, BADTAB, Baeoli, Bathysphere, The Bats, By A Damn Sight, Cindy, Eveline Breaker, Goya, Half/Angel, Hans Pucket, Iris Little, Jazmine Mary, Jen Cloher, JessB, JHL, Jim Nothing, Jordan Hamel, Leah Dodd, LEAO, Louisa Nicklin, The Phoenix Foundation, Reb Fountain, Rebecca Hawkes, Shayne P Carter (solo), Sig Wilder & Friends, Sofia Machray, Space Bats, Attack!, The Spectre Collective: live-scored cinema, Star Time, plus more artists to be announced soon.

events.id: Dancesplash 2025-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Dancesplash 2025
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
ArtSplash is a week-long festival, held every two years, that celebrates tāmariki and rangatahi experiencing performance on the big stage in dance and choir concerts. This year, we have two separate groups performing – one at ArtSplash and the other at DanceSplash.
Mrs Long and Mr Graff have a hard-working troupe of dancers training to perform on Thursday 28 August at the 5pm show, held at the Opera House.
This is a new venue for the show, what a treat! This group will be heading into town by 8:15am for the dress rehearsal, before returning to school to catch their breath. They’ll head back in together on the bus and will be ready to head home with their spectator parents at the conclusion of the show. Watch this space for more details and how you can help.
Tickets are now on sale. You can purchase them via the Ticketmaster website. NOTE: Due to limited seating and a high number of schools involved, there is a limit of TWO tickets per performer. Don’t miss out!

events.id: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beginner Jewellery Making In 8 Weeks - Mondays
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
It starts on Monday 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Monday 13 October, 5.30-pm - 8 pm.
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals.

events.long_description:
Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. The block starts on Mon 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Mon 13 October, 5.30pm - 8pm.
The stone setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Course fee $440, early bird $396 till 27 July.
Included in the class fee are a copper and brass pack for practising on, a sterling silver pack, 2 gemstones and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.

events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An introduction to Coshop.nz, a new open source platform connecting communities directly to local farmers that is being trialled in Wellington with Kaibosh and Wesley Community Action. 

This talk will also look at existing models of community engagement in food systems, some problems with the existing models and how tech could enable communities and small farmers to regain power in the food system.

events.id: Governance Reporting for Effective Decision-Making!-Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street.-Humanitix
events.name: Governance Reporting for Effective Decision-Making!
events.venue: Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street.
events.long_description:
Note: This is a Hybrid Event:
In-Person Location: Microsoft, Level 13 , 10 Brandon Street, Wellington.
Online: The Zoom link will be sent out the day before the event.
About this event:
About this event:

Effective governance reporting is essential for successful project, programme, and portfolio delivery. Join us for an exclusive webinar where two industry experts—each representing leading software tools—will share insights on how to optimize reporting processes, enhance decision-making, and track progress with precision.

This session will explore critical elements of governance reporting, including the dashboards and key information decision makers need to ensure transparency and accountability. Our speakers will showcase best practices for structuring reports, selecting the right performance indicators, and using real-time data to drive strategic outcomes. Learn how to streamline reporting workflows, reduce manual effort, and leverage technology to provide stakeholders with clear, actionable insights.

Whether you're managing a single project, a programme, an entire portfolio, PMO, or a member of any delivery governance committee, this webinar will equip you with practical strategies and the right tools to improve oversight and control. Gain valuable knowledge from experts in project governance and software solutions that support effective reporting.
About the Presenter:
About the Presenters:

Youssef Mourra is the founder, Director, and Principal Consultant at Nonsuch. He delivers consulting across all the layers of Project, Programme and Portfolio Management (P3M) in organisations of any size and type. He is known for developing practical and pragmatic solutions that help organisations achieve their desired business outcomes and to execute their strategies.

Bruce Aylward is the "Chief Everything Officer" of Psoda, isn't your average tech CEO. His journey took him from the starry skies of rocket science to revolutionizing cloud-based project management software.
PDU's Available:
PDU's Available: Total = 1.5 PDU's
• Ways of Working - 0.5
• Power Skills - 1
Course Identifier: PMINZ202584
PDU Claim Code:012988AK4J
Hosted by: PMINZ Leaders in Project Delivery Special Interest Group and the Wellington Branch of PMINZ

events.id: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block B
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Io-Io
Week 4: Bonus
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.
Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week term cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students.
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukFunB

events.id: Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best-10 Surrey St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Steps To Success - The recipe to competing at your best
events.venue: 10 Surrey St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you become the best athlete possible. No matter your level, weather you are a beginner, an amatuer or a pro, this workshop has the recipe to start competing at your best. You don't even have to be competing! You could just want to do better.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and performance focus with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

events.id: Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.
