events.id: Breathwork: A Gentle Reset-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Take a pause from the noise of daily life.
This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.
You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:
A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages
A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding
Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.
To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.
Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.
Why Breathwork?
Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.
You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.
Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

events.id: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Habits mastery series: Buy Back Your Time
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
You don’t need more hours in the day — you just need to stop spending them on the wrong things.
You’re busy. I get it. There’s just no time for the things that you really want to do, right?
"Buy Back Your Time" is a 1-hour interactive workshop for anyone who wants to reclaim their time, energy, and focus — without burnout or hustle culture.
In this session, you'll learn:
Why time management is really attention management
How to shift from reacting to designing your days
Practical tools to create space for what actually matters
How to identify & eliminate your biggest time-wasters
You’ll walk away with a simple plan to buy back your time — and start investing it in your goals, your growth, and your life.
Meet your host, Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!
6.15pm Tuesday 26th August
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets

events.id: Humans: Why & What To Do-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Humans: Why & What To Do
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Humans: Why & What To Do
Talk by Devamrita Swami + Plant-Based Dinner & Dessert
We’re the most connected generation in history — and somehow the loneliest.
We’ve built more technology than any civilisation before us — and still can’t solve our basic problems.
We talk endlessly about progress — while the planet burns and mental health plummets.
What if the trouble isn’t just what we’re doing… but that we’ve forgotten why we’re doing it?
In this bold, no-fluff talk, Devamrita Swami — a world-traveling monk, strategist, and social critic — unpacks the mess we’re in and asks the questions most of us avoid: Why are we here? And what should we actually be doing about it?
Afterwards, stick around for a plant-based dinner and dessert — fresh, colourful, and made to share. Grab a plate, grab a seat, and dive into real conversations with people who are curious, open-minded, and up for something different.
Meet Devamrita Swami, your host:
Devamrita Swami is an educator, author, and monk who has spent over forty years exploring and sharing the wisdom of bhakti-yoga. He brings ancient Vedic teachings to life, effortlessly navigating the latest research in archaeology, consciousness, ancient history, neuroscience, social science, and psychology. Author of Searching for Vedic India and Hiding in Unnatural Happiness, he combines philosophy with practical insights on happiness, wellbeing, and personal fulfillment. For anyone seeking to channel the human drive for fulfilment in a meaningful and sustainable way, Devamrita Swami offers clear, engaging, and indispensable wisdom.

Master Your Mornings: a Routine That Works
Take charge of your mornings and set yourself up for a productive, goal-driven day. A well-designed morning routine can give you focus, fuel your ambition, and create momentum that carries through everything you do. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to build a routine that fits your life and drives your success.
Dive into the science behind effective morning habits, pick up practical strategies for building routines that stick, and explore proven techniques to stay motivated and on track. Whether your goal is to enhance productivity, improve wellbeing, or cultivate mindfulness, this workshop gives you the tools to turn your mornings into a launchpad for long-term achievements.

Understand the psychology behind morning habits and why they matter

Build a morning routine that sets you up for success, every single day

Start each day with intention, clarity, and the momentum to reach your goals

events.id: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Men's Circle: Reclaiming Connection
The Men’s Circle is a free, supportive gathering for men to connect, share openly, and grow together. Whether you're navigating life changes, seeking community, or simply wanting a space to be heard, you're welcome here.
Expect honest conversations and the kind of connection that’s rare but necessary. No pressure to speak—just your presence is enough. We follow a respectful, non-judgmental format that prioritizes safety, confidentiality, and authenticity.
Optional Plant-Based Dinner
Stay afterwards for a nourishing, plant-based dinner and dessert ($15). Sharing a meal is a powerful way to extend the connection beyond the circle. This gathering is not run for profit—Andre is simply passionate about creating spaces for genuine connection.
What to Expect in the Circle:
Gathering in Circle: We sit in a circle to foster a sense of unity and equality.
Centering In: A short meditation or silence helps us arrive and ground.
Talking Object: A shared object moves around—only the person holding it speaks.
Optional Sharing: Speak if you feel moved. You’re always welcome to pass.
Active Listening: No interruptions, advice, or feedback—just presence.
Confidentiality: What's shared in the circle, stays in the circle.
Our Shared Agreements:
Speak from the “I”: Share from your own experience, not on behalf of others.
No fixing or judging: This is not a space to solve, but to witness.
Be present: Share what’s alive for you right now.
Respect and trust: We uphold a culture of care, confidentiality, and non-judgment.
Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. Over the years, Andre has come to value the power of sitting in circle—of men coming together in honesty, vulnerability, and presence to witness and support one another. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.

events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia
It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!
Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.
With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.
What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!
Why You Won’t Want to Miss This
A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound
A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal
Limited spaces
Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.
Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud Claudio Escutia
Instagram Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)

events.name: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos through hypnosis
If your brain won’t stop running in circles, this workshop is for you.
In 60 minutes, we’ll unpack why your mind loves to overthink, how to break out of thought spirals before they swallow your day, and I’ll guide you through a relaxing hypnosis to quiet the noise on the spot. You’ll leave with simple tools you can use anytime life feels too loud.


Meet your host, Gopi
Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity, overcome negative thought patterns and habits through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, trauma informed coach, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.
6.15pm Tuesday 9th September
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

A deeply soothing experience of rest and regulation — followed by a delicious plant-based dinner.
This guided Yoga Nidra session invites you to slow down and settle the body, mind, and breath. Through gentle awareness practices and calming visualizations, Emma will guide you into a state of deep rest where your nervous system can begin to unwind and reset.

After the session, stay to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, included in your ticket — a gentle way to nourish, connect, and carry the calm into your evening.
Meet Emma, your host
With a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga certification and a background in the corporate world, Emma brings both groundedness and empathy to her teaching. Her approach is slow, intentional, and centered on creating a space where your body feels safe to relax and release.

events.id: BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford-126 Vivian Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford
events.venue: 126 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join 5ever books for the celebration and launch of Johnny Crawford's 'Downstream from Nowhere'!
Trades Hall, 124 Vivian Street
Friday 29 August 2025
6:30PM - whenevz
Free entry, all welcome, nibbles and drinks available, accompanied with sentimental words and live serenades.
~~~~~~
In the two centuries since the first Pākehā set foot in what would go on to be known as the Messines Valley, it has seen its fair share of history. Music Festivals. Failed settlements. Paranormal phenomena.
As the stolen land passed through the hands of church and state and capital, each left its mark. ‘Downstream from Nowhere’ follows this course through the eyes of the valley’s least reputable visitors.
~~~~~~
"Crawford sends us running straight into a tornado of intergenerational colonial mindsets, jingoistic historicism, and pop-cultural epochs, with a goat's head in one hand and a kebab in the other" - Jordan Hamel
Art by Miriam Collins, Sam Low and Nabilah Husna Binte Abdul Rahman. Cover designed by Achille Segard.

During this magic-filled workshop you'll: - create a powerful, personalised deck of Oracle Cards - learn about the history behind Oracle + Tarot Cards - learn how to read your cards and use them as a tool of self-reflection - channel sacred message from your guides to add to your deck - be inspired by artist-created Oracle + Tarot decks from all over the world - tap into your personal cultural lineage to harness symbols with generational power This workshop is great for folk at all levels of artistic skill!
It's also child-friendly.
Hosted at Green House Store, Island Bay.
Parking is available.

Brace yourself for an evening dripping with glamour, sparkle, and a whole lot of cheek as you soak in the skyline of Wellington's most unique rooftop hideaway
DIRTY LITTLE SECRET!
Slip into something fabulous, grab your favorite drink, and get ready for an extravagant night of DRAG BINGO! We've got cocktails that'll make you blush, and more laughs than you can shake a feather boa at!
Expect live drag performances to make your heart race, dad jokes that'll have you in stitches, and beats from our fabulous local DJs that'll keep you moving all night long! Book your table for 7.00pm, balls dropping 7.30 at the latest!

Hold onto your wigs, honey, because it's FREE to enter! And we have well over $200 worth of PRIZES to be won! including our grand prize... $100.00 BAR VOUCHER! odds not in your favour? we have SPOT PRIZES up for grabs, so sexy naughty and fun I'm not allowed to mention them on this media platform!

events.venue: 9 Edward Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.
When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.
The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.
With support from Frances Grass.

events.id: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn-93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn
events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.

events.id: WECG ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING 2025-19 Makora Road, Otaihanga , Paraparaumu-Facebook
events.name: WECG ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING 2025
events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga , Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING
Tena Tatou Katoa, Greetings Everyone
A WARM INVITATION TO ALL TO ATTEND THE 2025 AGM OF THE WAIKANAE ESTUARY CARE GROUP INC
Venue: The Otaihanga Boating Club, Makora Rd,
Otaihanga
Date & time: Wednesday 3rd September at 7pm
Speaker Mike Joy - see Bio below

Mike is a Senior Research Fellow and Lecturer in Environmental Science at the School of Geography, Environment and Earth Sciences, Mike’s research includes ecological modelling, freshwater bioassessment, environmental policy, biophysical limits to growth and the role of energy in society. He is publicly outspoken about the decline in freshwater quality and ecosystems, especially the impact of nutrient pollution from intensive dairying on New Zealand's "100% Pure", clean, green image.
Mike is an outspoken advocate for environmental protection in New Zealand and for this has received several awards including an Ecology in Action award from the NZ Ecological Society, the Charles Fleming Award for environmental achievement in 2013 and in 2023 the Callaghan Medal for science communication from the Royal Society of New Zealand. In 2015 he was awarded the Morgan Foundation inaugural River Voice Award and in 2017 the inaugural NZ Universities Critic and Conscience award. His book 'The Fight for Freshwater' is a memoir that provides a rare first hand look at those whose voices question the health and future of our waterways.
The Meeting will conclude with supper and korero

Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington)-Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: CMNZ Series: Takács Quartet (Wellington)
events.venue: Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2025, the Takács Quartet are among the world’s top tier chamber ensembles.
PROGRAMME
* Joseph Haydn | String Quartet in G minor, Op. 74, No. 3 “The Rider”
* Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow
* Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No. 9 in C major, Op. 59 No. 3
ARTISTS
Edward Dusinberre, Violin
Harumi Rhodes, Violin
Richard O’Neill, Viola
András Fejér, Cello
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op. 74, No. 3, known as The Rider – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No. 9, Op. 59 No. 3, Razumovsky.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.
Come in and out of silence
Tone swirling in the balance.
Nothing, then everything
Waving into space.
Then light
And after a longer while
Air.
And now sixteen strings manually animated
Vibrating through time.
Nokuthula Ngwenyama
events.description:
3 “The Rider” * Nokuthula Ngwenyama | Flow * Ludwig van Beethoven | String Quartet No.
Edward Dusinberre, Violin Harumi Rhodes, Violin Richard O’Neill, Viola András Fejér, Cello Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s String Quartets, the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op.

Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work - Flow by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.

events.id: Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna-Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna
events.venue: Edilsons Building, 171 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.
San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Heaven & Earth: Celebrating 25 Years of Bold Sounds-Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Heaven & Earth: Celebrating 25 Years of Bold Sounds
events.venue: Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description: Heaven & Earth marks 25 years of Stroma’s fearless exploration of sound and spirit since our inaugural concert Wind, Rain & Light in August 2000. We recall the theme of that first concert by similarly evoking musical impressions of the earth below and the sky above. Featuring a world premiere by New York-based NZ composer Leila Adu-Gilmore, the programme includes Olivier Messiaen’s ecstatic Louange à l’immortalité de Jésus, Gemma Peacocke’s Sky Fields, John Rimmer’s Where Sea Meets Sky 2, Michael Norris’s new piano trio The Spaces In Between, and—to mark the recent passing of Sofia Gubaidulina—her meditative Garden of Joy and Sorrow. Come join us in celebrating a quarter century of intrepid sonic exploration from the musicians of Stroma.

events.name: Iron
events.venue: Atlas House, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.
The Cast
Faye - Karen Anslow
Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

events.id: NZTrio presents Fantastique-30 The Terrace, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: NZTrio presents Fantastique
events.venue: 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Renowned classical music ensemble NZTrio He Taonga Wairere present their extraordinary programme Fantastique.
Described as a "national treasure" and "New Zealand's most indispensable ensemble" (William Dart, NZ Herald), NZTrio combines warm kiwi stage presence with musicians at the top of their craft.
Amalia Hall (violin), Somi Kim (piano) and Callum Hall (guest cello) explore a lavish tapestry of styles and emotions in Fantastique, a programme of contrasts. Turina's Circulo depicts a single day through dawn, midday and dusk, while brooding disquiet meets stark intensity in Shostakovich's Piano Trio No.1 in C minor. Chen Yi's Tibetan Tunes creates a fusion of traditional Tibetan melodies referencing Buddhist god Du Mu, before the premiere of Angelus, a new commission by one of Aotearoa’s most acclaimed composers, John Psathas. Finally, Franck's youthful Piano Trio No. 1 in F sharp minor is as charming and intimate as it is powerful and explosive.

events.id: MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)-92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
events.venue: 92 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT!!!!
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
events.description:
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s.
And it beats loud.

events.id: Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Brazilian Zouk - Introduction to Tilted turns
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block D (5 weeks).
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block D you will get an Introduction to Tilted turns as well as some exercises on Floor craft and the Social Dance experience.
===Prices and payment:
- Prepaid 5 week Block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukImpD
===Location:
Classes are in Studio 6, Level 5, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street
===Housekeeping:
- You should have completed the 4 beginner Class blocks before joining Improvers classes
- Drop in or new students, please get in contact before the start of class to let us know you are interested so we can assess your level and organise a private class if necessary to catch you up. If you just show up on the night, you are welcome to watch the class but will not be able to join in (this is to respect the learning of our regular students as the classes are progressive)

events.name: FIZZWIZARD - The Return!!!
events.venue: 5 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Aleister ‘Fizzwizard’ Campbell returns from Tamaki Makaurau (Auckland) to his hometown to inflict all manner of psychedelic-blues-joy upon the good people of Te-Upoko-o-te-Ika (Wellington).
Trained in a jazz conservatory then corrupted in dive bars and on the streets, Aleister James Campbell, with his evergreen love of Charlie Parker & Jimi Hendrix, is known for his spell-binding stage presence and deep connection to the music.
Currently on the run from the Jazz Police for inappropriate Wah Wah use in a straight-ahead jazz context...

events.id: Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
After ten years, Cairo Knife Fight is finally returning to New Zealand for a limited series of intimate shows. Known for their powerful live performances and genre-bending sound, the duo
is set to bring their unmistakable energy back to local stages.
Since their last performances in New Zealand, CKF has continued to push musical boundaries, earning Billboard chart success with tracks like “Churn” and “Nothing at All.”
Their latest EP, Dream Season, showcases the band's ever-evolving sound—fusing intricate live looping,
intense rhythms, and ambient textures. This homecoming is more than a tour—it’s a full-circle moment for one of NZ’s most innovative exports.
Joining CKF at Meow will be Wellington based Sheeps. Described as Art Rock for the end times, Sheeps are definitely the right band at the right time to partner CKF in 2025.
Don’t miss the return of Cairo Knife Fight. It’s been a long time coming.

events.id: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,-Event Brite
events.name: Otago Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Union Street East Room G. Dunedin,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families- Taranaki Street Wellington,-Event Brite
events.name: When the Family Fractures: Working Confidently with Separated Families
events.venue: Taranaki Street Wellington,
events.description:
Parental Separation affects a significant proportion of our clients, yet most practitioners receive minimal training in managing these complex family dynamics.
It will help clinicians who feel uncertain when separation dynamics emerge in individual therapy, or who are struggling with managing consent issues and parent involvement.
Especially if you are worried your therapeutic recommendations might complicate legal matters; you're unsure when to take on these cases and when to refer; or your between-session workload with these clients is unsustainable.
You'll Leave Knowing: evidence-based interventions that work in separated family contexts how separation impacts child development and attachment tools to identify red flags, know which cases to accept and when to refer when you need both parents' consent (and when you don't) how to prevent being triangulated and maintain therapeutic boundaries confidence about providing court-appropriate documentation methods to structure sessions and manage between-session contact how to protect yourself legally while maintaining therapeutic effectiveness This workshop is fully catered.
Her approach integrates ACT, Compassion-Focused Therapy, and ProSocial principles with practical strategies drawn from extensive experience in: expert witness testimony in Family Court proceedings court-mandated therapy for families in legal disputes child and adolescent mental health services youth justice system intervention perinatal mental health support working with neurodivergent children and their families Her career spans leadership roles including Past President of the ANZ Association for Contextual Behavioural Science, Research Associate for Telethon Kids Institute, and Council Member for Collaborative Practice Western Australia.

events.description:

The course is aimed at anyone who is new to club management, moving into club management or even those who have years of experience and want to refresh their knowledge and skills.

events.description:

Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys.
Dates This block course consists of 4 workshops: 10.30am-11.45am Tuesday 19th August – Re-finding yourself Tuesday 26th August – Caring for your needs Tuesday 2nd September - Self-compassion Tuesday 9th September – Seeing potential Cost $46 per session, $184 total Included in each session You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance.
No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.

events.long_description:
Join John Chow — entrepreneur, investor, and co-founder of Stonewood Group — for an evening of real-world insights into entrepreneurship, innovation, and the future of business in the AI era.

Whether you’re a founder, freelancer, investor, or simply AI-curious, this is your chance to hear directly from one of New Zealand’s boldest business leaders and walk away inspired.

Keynote: “Lessons from the Past, Eyes on the Future: A Founder’s Take on AI”
John shares his entrepreneurial journey and how he’s thinking about AI as a tool for the next wave of business growth.

A live podcast-style conversation between John Chow and Bin Wang (Head of AI, Stonewood Group), unpacking how real companies can embrace AI without the hype.

Networking + Giveaways
Mix and mingle with fellow professionals, founders, and AI enthusiasts. Enjoy drinks and enter the draw to win prizes!

Presented by:
Urban Hub Wellington
Workspaces built for entrepreneurs, growing teams, and professionals who want to do more with their day.

events.venue: 44 Hill Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
f🌍 Global Climate Leadership: UK–NZ–UN Collaboration
Hosted by UNANZ Wellington in partnership with the British High Commission, Wellington
Join us for an engaging evening of insight and diplomacy as we explore how the United Kingdom, New Zealand, and the United Nations are working together to drive global climate leadership.
This timely event brings together perspectives on international cooperation, policy innovation, and the urgent challenges of our climate future. John Pearson, Deputy British High Commissioner at the British High Commission, will deliver a keynote speech followed by an open Q&A, offering a unique chance for attendees to ask questions and be part of the conversation.
Whether you're passionate about sustainability, international relations, or meaningful dialogue, this event offers value, inspiration, and connection.
Why attend?
Learn about climate diplomacy in action
Engage with leaders shaping global climate responses
Network with professionals, students, and changemakers
Enjoy light refreshments in a diplomatic setting
🗓️ Date: Tuesday, 26 August 2025
🕔 Time: 5:00 PM – 6:30 PM
📍 Venue: British High Commission, Wellington
🎟️ RSVP Required – Limited Spaces
Networking Reception: From 6:30 pm with canapes and drinks kindly sponsored by the British High Commission.
FOR ANY DIETARY:
Please email us at ishant.ghulyani@unanz.org.nz
Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a global conversation, right here in Wellington.

events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.long_description:
Created by Tempest Theatre Co

Back for its five year anniversary, Emma Maguire and Hamish Boyle run the gauntlet of sketch comedy, performing 15+ sketches about love, sex, queerness and rom-coms in 55 minutes.
It's delirious, it'll get your blood pumping (not like that), and maybe we'll all come out of it satisfied.

Interrogating love languages and horoscopes.

The works.

events.id: The Greatest Story - A Group of Wise Teachers Returning-Kāpiti College Library Room, Margaret Rd, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: The Greatest Story - A Group of Wise Teachers Returning
events.venue: Kāpiti College Library Room, Margaret Rd, Raumati
events.long_description:
Public Talk & Workshop

Throughout history, especially at times of crisis, great spiritual teachers have emerged to show humanity the next step forward.

According to British artist, author and esotericist Benjamin Creme, a group of such spiritual teachers is now living in the modern world. Maitreya, the World Teacher, and his group The Masters of Wisdom are here - not as religious teachers - to inspire all people to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; and for humanity to act to do the work to share and save our world.

Humanity at spiritual crossroads

Humanity is at crossroads. One path into the future leads to increasing social and economic division, environmental destruction, war and planetary peril. The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.


Maitreya’s priorities

To help humanity in its task of global transformation, Maitreya has formulated certain priorities. They cover the essential needs of all people, every woman, man and child: an adequate supply of food; housing for all; healthcare and education as basic universal rights. Other top priorities include the restoration of the environment and the establishment of peace.

The key to achieving these goals requires a major shift of present mind-set and thinking, structures and systems – and more equitable sharing of the world’s food and resources. To realise humanity is one global family and the planet is a living being. According to Maitreya: “Without sharing, there can be no justice; without justice, there can be no peace; without peace, there can be no future.”

~ followed by short Transmission Meditation session ~

Share International New Zealand. Contact (021) 261 2749
Access - entrance from Raumati Road/ walk - drive past Te Raukura ki Kāpiti / Kāpiti Performing Arts Centre
events.description:
Maitreya, the World Teacher, and his group The Masters of Wisdom are here - not as religious teachers - to inspire all people to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; and for humanity to act to do the work to share and save our world.
Humanity at spiritual crossroads Humanity is at crossroads.
The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.
Other top priorities include the restoration of the environment and the establishment of peace.
To realise humanity is one global family and the planet is a living being.

events.name: 6 Week Meditation Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 20 Alexander Rd, Raumati
events.description:
The goals we have set for this course are: - to understand the principles of meditation practice - to be able to sit comfortably and still - the ability to follow a basic meditation technique independently - to establish a regular home meditation practice - to be inspired to further develop knowledge and skills in meditation In our daily lives, we increasingly need more focus, inner clarity, and perhaps most of all, inner peace.
These qualities are inherent to us, though sometimes hidden by a busy mind.
This course will provide both theoretical and practical methods to reconnect with your Self.
Suitable for complete beginners, those returning to their practice after a break, or anyone seeking the support of the Sangha.
If you would like to attend the course online please email us at: kapiti@yogaindailylife.org.nz for the Zoom link.

events.venue: TBD Horowhenua, TBD
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

events.id: Bakery & Brewery-Dough Bakery HQ, 12 Railway Avenue-WOAP
events.name: Bakery & Brewery
events.venue: Dough Bakery HQ, 12 Railway Avenue
events.long_description:
Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!

events.id: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!

events.id: A Night on the Orient Express-The Botanist, 219 Onepu Rd-WOAP
events.name: A Night on the Orient Express
events.venue: The Botanist, 219 Onepu Rd
events.long_description:
All aboard as The Botanist turns into The Orient Express. Your tasty train journey will begin in Paris, heading to Istanbul via Germany, Austria, Serbia, Hungary and Bulgaria. The 7-course menu features modern plant-based takes on traditional dishes from each country’s cuisine, such as French crepes with vegan duck a l'orange, coconut-crusted parsnip Austrian schnitzel and Bulgarian kashkaval house-made cultured cashew cheese and spinach pastry; paired with creative cocktails, live music and some iconic Orient Express touches.
 
7-course tasting menu. Matched cocktails (alcoholic or non-alchoholic) can be added to your ticket.

events.id: Sweet Sensations-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Sweet Sensations
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description: Noble Rot wants to sing the praises of sweet wines and help you to learn that they aren't just one note. They'll showcase a range of wines from around the world that lean towards the sweeter side without leaving a cloying sensation on your palate, enhanced by a specially-curated five-course degustation menu from entree to dessert. If you would like to explore your favourite level of sweetness in wine, this event is for you. The knowledgeable Noble Rot team are here to show you that sweetness is one of wine’s most versatile assets, as well-balanced sweetness in wine can be delicate, elegant and complementary to both sweet and savoury dishes. Discover how some grape varieties are more suited to producing sweeter wines and how their level of sweetness is achieved. If you're into the sweeter things in life, this one is for you.

events.id: Wellington Leaders Day-22 Tennyson Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Leaders Day
events.venue: 22 Tennyson Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Testimonies are emerging from churches across Aotearoa of an openness to faith, responses from people previously not interested in church, and a curiosity about Christ and Christianity among non-believers, particularly young people.
As church and Christian leaders in Aotearoa New Zealand, how might we respond in our contexts?
Session Two: Stories of Renewal In this panel discussion, local pastors and leaders share stories of how they are seeing that God has been moving — stirring renewal and hope, unexpected shifts in discipleship and salvations, and how they are responding.
Session Four: Renewal Conversations What does it look like to steward renewal in our churches?
This session focuses on practical responses to renewal and discussion around how the Church in Aotearoa can partner with what the Spirit is doing.

events.name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Dunedin
events.venue: 310 Princes Street, Central Dunedin, Dunedin 9016
events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille-Taranaki Wharf, Taranaki Wharf 2 Taranaki Street, Waterfront, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Poroporoaki for Rosalie & Welcome to Elizabeth & Shaquille
events.venue: Taranaki Wharf, Taranaki Wharf 2 Taranaki Street, Waterfront, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora e te whānau EHF,
You're invited to a very special evening!
Join us on Wednesday 27 August at 5:30pm for a heart-filled poroporoaki, a chance to celebrate Rosalie Nelson, and to officially welcome our new Co-Executive Directors, Elizabeth McNaughton and Shaquille Shortland.
📍 Te Wharewaka Function Centre, Wellington
🕔 Doors open at 5:00pm | Welcome begins at 5:30pm sharp
🕢 Event concludes by 7:30pm
👔 Dress: Business casual
To RSVP (button)
To register to join online (button)
This will be a joyful evening of reflection, reconnection and looking ahead. Whether you're joining us in person or online, we’d love to have you in the room (or on the screen!) as we mark this milestone in the life of the Fellowship. You are also welcome to bring your partner.
In te ao Māori, a poroporoaki is more than a farewell; it's a ritual of transition and gratitude. A moment to steady the waka, acknowledge the hands that have guided it, and prepare together for the voyage ahead.
We’ll honour Rosalie’s contribution, and we’ll raise a glass to Elizabeth and Shaquille as they step into their new roles. Expect warmth, good company, big-hearted kōrero and a few surprises too.
If you're planning to attend in person and haven’t yet booked travel, now’s a good time to do so.

Ngā manaakitanga,
The EHF Board

events.id: Songs for my Chatbot-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Songs for my Chatbot
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Generative AI is everywhere.
Each campaign presents it as an efficiency fix, often for problems it invented.
Yet efficiency collapses in fields that thrive on the very search for problems.
In the creative arts, including music, the goal usually is not to solve problems; it’s to seek them, wrestle with them and forge novel, unexpected forms of expression.
That clash between algorithmic speed, and the creative value of exploration sets the stage for this session.

events.id: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study-17 Boulcott Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: EYA Presents: The Bible and the Sacraments Bible Study
events.venue: 17 Boulcott Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
What are the Sacraments? Where do they come from? What do they mean? And why are they so central to our Catholic Faith?
In The Bible and the Sacraments, you’ll discover the deeply biblical roots of the Seven Sacraments and how they are more than mere Church rituals, but streams of life flowing from the living Body of Christ.
Throughout this study, you’ll discover how God has always dealt with His people through “sacraments,” and how the sacraments of the Old Testament find their ultimate fulfillment in the Seven Sacraments instituted by Christ and celebrated in the Catholic Church to this day.
Eucharistia Young Adults (EYA) introduces our second Bible study for 2025! This eleven-lesson Bible study by St Paul Center will delve into the beauty of the sacraments of the Catholic Church.
Please bring your Bible, journal, pen - and of course, your lovely self! Bring your friends, co-workers, family members, the more the merrier!
__________________
Every Wednesday | 16 July 2025 - 08 October 2025
St Mary's of the Angels Parish Hall
Everyone is most welcome!

events.id: He Waka Eke Noa: Reflections-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: He Waka Eke Noa: Reflections
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai, hoki mai, Join us for the final panel discussion for Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum Legal Series, where we discuss the purpose, historical significance and ongoing mahi of The Waitangi Tribunal, held alongside the exhibition He Kura Toi Tangata: 50 Years of the Waitangi Tribunal, 1975-2025.
Here to discuss the future of Te Tiriti are a panel of outspoken young leaders, chaired by veteran Māori lawyer Annette Sykes, as we ask, ‘What will be the mahi of the Waitangi Tribunal in 2075?’ and ‘How can we uphold the mana of Te Tiriti ourselves to ensure mana motuhake for our mokopuna, and secure a just and equitable Aotearoa for all future generations of New Zealanders?’ Tickets are $35 per session, or $25 for students and SuperGold Card holders, and include one drink and light kai.
She has also been involved in the Waitangi Tribunal Claims and is an adjunct professor at the Faculty of Law at Auckland University, as part of a commitment to ensuring the reclaiming of Māori law, Tikanga Māori as the first law of this nation.
Luke’s research and teaching interests are centred on Te Tiriti o Waitangi, Family Law, Child Protection and Children’s Rights.
Tamatha is the first ever Māori MP for Wellington Central, as well as the youngest MP for the Green Party.

events.id: The Art of Mending-157 Hataitai Road, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Art of Mending
events.venue: 157 Hataitai Road, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
When it comes to the clothes we love, every rip, stain, and imperfection is an invitation to exercise agency, expression, and an opportunity to show the garment how much we appreciate it.
This class is cared for by the whimsical Aisha, a multidisciplinary artist with a passion for empowering the mending process. Each month on Wednesday evenings Aisha will introduce us to a different technique for reviving our beloved textile pieces. If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you. With three events a month we'll inspire each other to creatively care for those pieces we love! This club is also perfect for anyone who loves learning new skills. Techniques we'll cover are lino printing, patching, darning, felting, embroidery, beading, sashiko, fabric painting and more! All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own. We highly encourage bringing those clothes or other textile items that need some love and repair.
There is no need to attend every class. We can catch you up on the skill at which ever class you choose to join us at. There are single class tickets or monthly sign ups available. Both of these have variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances!
In August we are Lino Printing!
Class 02: 20th August
At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with! You're welcome to keep going with the pre cut designs as well. Lino and carving tools will be supplied.
Class 03: 27th August
This class will be open to what you want to work on! Bring in larger project items, print with the lino cuts you made in the previous week, or cut some fresh ones!
In September we are patching!
Class 01: 10th September
Aisha will take us through the process of sewing on patches. Patches that we printed in the August classes will be available for this. You're welcome to bring your own patches as well. Please bring something that needs a patch up or a little bit of decoration.
Class 02: 17th September
At this class we will learn how to appliqué, the process of using scrap fabric to make decorative patches. This is a great way to elevate a rip or stain with some visible mending.
Class 03: 24th September
At this last class of the month we'll be open for all the patching needs. Hang out and finish projects we've started or mend some extra items.
Be sure to check our website or here for updates about techniques coming up in the following months.
events.description:
If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you.
All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own.
Class 02: 20th August At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with!
Patches that we printed in the August classes will be available for this.
Class 03: 24th September At this last class of the month we'll be open for all the patching needs.

If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you. With three events a month we'll inspire each other to creatively care for those pieces we love! This club is also perfect for anyone who loves learning new skills. Techniques we'll cover are lino printing, patching, darning, felting, embroidery, beading, sashiko, fabric painting and more! All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own. We highly encourage bringing those clothes or other textile items that need some love and repair.

There is no need to attend every class. We can catch you up on the skill at which ever class you choose to join us at. There are single class tickets or monthly sign ups available. Both of these have variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances!

In August we are Lino Printing!
Class 02: 20th August
At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with! You're welcome to keep going with the pre cut designs as well. Lino and carving tools will be supplied.

Class 03: 27th August
This class will be open to what you want to work on! Bring in larger project items, print with the lino cuts you made in the previous week, or cut some fresh ones!

In September we are patching!
Class 01: 10th September
Aisha will take us through the process of sewing on patches. Patches that we printed in the August classes will be available for this. You're welcome to bring your own patches as well. Please bring something that needs a patch up or a little bit of decoration.

Class 02: 17th September
At this class we will learn how to appliqué, the process of using scrap fabric to make decorative patches. This is a great way to elevate a rip or stain with some visible mending.

Class 03: 24th September
At this last class of the month we'll be open for all the patching needs. Hang out and finish projects we've started or mend some extra items.

Be sure to check our website or here for updates about techniques coming up in the following months.

All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own.
Class 02: 20th August At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with!
Patches that we printed in the August classes will be available for this.
Class 03: 24th September At this last class of the month we'll be open for all the patching needs.

30 years later the building is no longer fit for purpose.
Patient numbers have increased significantly (the team cares for around 200 patients a year) and the team of staff and volunteers who are based in the building has grown to the point where some staff have been accommodated in a temporary porta cabin, and there are no ‘hot desk’ facilities for staff visiting from other teams.

events.id: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course-61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Intro to Musical Improv | A PopRox Improv Course
events.venue: 61 - 69 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the first workshop.

events.name: Roger Hall's Easy Money
events.venue: Mana Little Theatre, 9 Sunset Parade, Plimmerton, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
A comedy plot driven farce loosely based on Ben Johnson’s Jacobean Tale The Alchemist, set in the current day. A laugh a minute tale of greed, described by Hall as having “no moral, no message – just entertainment”

An Australian couple is based in a swanky Auckland harbourside Airbnb, armed with a loose plan to shake down as many self-satisfied cashed-up “neighbours” as possible; in the hope of a quick payday and an early retirement. All about greed and how a fool and their money are soon parted; with double crosses, dirty tricks and dodgy dealings….It’s so audacious, you can see the dollar signs flickering in the eyes of their marks.

(Revised in 2022 to update and change ethnicity)
Directed by Teresa Sullivan

events.id: Terror-Fi Presents: THE TOXIC AVENGER (NZ Premiere - Wellington)-12 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Terror-Fi Presents: THE TOXIC AVENGER (NZ Premiere - Wellington)
events.venue: 12 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Be the first in New Zealand to see THE TOXIC AVENGER, starring Peter Dinklage, Kevin Bacon, and our favourite adopted Kiwi Elijah Wood.
Comically violent, absurdly gory, and extremely entertaining ... Toxie is the radioactive antidote to superhero fatigue. 92% on Rotten Tomatoes and not to be missed on the big screen – especially as it almost didn’t make it to our cinemas!
“When a downtrodden janitor, Winston Gooze, is exposed to a catastrophic toxic accident, he’s transformed into a new kind of hero: The Toxic Avenger. Now, Toxie must rise from outcast to saviour, taking on ruthless corporate overlords and corrupt forces who threaten his son, his friends, and his community. In a world where greed runs rampant … justice is best served radioactive.”

events.id: Southland Mathematics Leadership Community 2025- Nelson Street Georgetown Invercargill,-Event Brite
events.name: Southland Mathematics Leadership Community 2025
events.venue: Nelson Street Georgetown Invercargill,
events.description:
Are you the maths lead in your school?
Register to join our Mathematics Leadership Community (MLC) and build your mathematics and statistics knowledge and leadership skills.
These MLC’s have been supporting mathematics leaders and teachers for over 18 years and we are excited to offer you the opportunity to be part of this network in 2025, which is shaping up to be a pivotal year in mathematics education.
Through engaging with current research and best practice, these meetings will enable leaders and teachers to: stay up to date with changes and implement Te Mātaiaho, Mathematics and Statistics Curriculum build capability in leading mathematics and statistics within and across their school investigate effective pedagogy and strategies for teaching and assessing mathematics and statistics connect and network with other leaders and teachers.
$350 for a 2025 Membership (+gst and booking fees) $100 for 1 meeting (+gst and booking fees) *Each ticket purchased gives entry for two attendees from 1 school* For any Kāhui Ako interested in this series, please contact us at info@cognitioneducation.com.

The event is a hub for creative minds to exchange ideas, share experiences, and build meaningful relationships across various industries.

events.id: Always a Bridesmaid-Zephyr Cafe, 217 Wakefield Street-WOAP
events.name: Always a Bridesmaid
events.venue: Zephyr Cafe, 217 Wakefield Street
events.long_description:
Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.

events.id: Cognac vs Armagnac-Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln-WOAP
events.name: Cognac vs Armagnac
events.venue: Noble Rot Wine Bar, 6 Swan Ln
events.long_description: Noble Rot sommelier Maciej Zimny has a undeniable passion for brandy, and he is yearning to share that with you. Maciej will guide you on an educational journey through this fascinating world focusing on the most prestigious French regions for brandy production: Cognac and Armagnac. He’ll provide detailed insight into the appellations, distillation and ageing processes, differences in oak maturation and why one region focuses on vintage expressions while the other ages blends for several years in barrel. But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly. Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.
events.description:

But don’t worry, this isn’t a classroom affair—they'll be pouring 8 different spirits paired to a unique three-course menu to showcase Maciej’s knowledge, and he’ll even teach you the sommelier’s techniques for how to taste spirits correctly.
Fall in love with brandy, find your favourite and next time you’re ordering a nightcap you can show off your new-found knowledge to your friends.

events.id: Young Flame-QT Wellington, 90 Cable Street-WOAP
events.name: Young Flame
events.venue: QT Wellington, 90 Cable Street
events.long_description: Young Flame is a dining experience inspired by fire. Think fire show and flaming cocktail on arrival to then dine surrounded by hundreds of flickering candles casting a warm glow, for an evening of fine finesse. QT Wellington’s Executive Chef, Antoine Collet, delivers a bold three-course chef’s tasting menu that’s as deliciously playful as it is refined. And if you like the finer things in life, while devouring each course you'll sip on beer & wine to your heart's desire and let the sultry sounds of live music weave through the room, adding a touch of old-school glamour to your night. Young Flame promises an evening steeped in elemental elegance.

events.venue: 109 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand
