events.id: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses-102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
events.venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
This practical two-hour in-person workshop is for real people in real businesses; who want to use AI to do more with the resources and tools they already have.
No tech jargon.
I’ve spent my career helping teams work smarter, minimise risks and leverage opportunities that come from doing business in our fast-changing world.

events.id: Westpac Smarts: Leadership & Resilience Lessons from Richie McCaw- Taranaki Street Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: Westpac Smarts: Leadership & Resilience Lessons from Richie McCaw
events.venue: Taranaki Street Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
What does it take to lead under pressure — and come out stronger?
In today’s fast-changing business world, resilience isn’t just a nice-to-have — it’s a must.
And few people understand that better than Richie McCaw.
Widely regarded as one of New Zealand’s greatest rugby players, Richie brings hard-earned insight into leading high-performing teams, staying grounded under pressure, and bouncing back from setbacks — lessons that resonate well beyond the field.
In this special Westpac Smarts session, you can join Richie for a candid conversation on leadership, grit, and the mindset it takes to thrive in challenging times.

events.id: Christine Wang and Rachel Thomson -- Violin and Piano-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Christine Wang and Rachel Thomson -- Violin and Piano
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for Ravel's Violin and Piano Sonata No. 2 and de Falla's Suite Populaire Espagnole based on “Siete canciones populares españolas,” along with Ginastera's hauntingly beautiful Pampeana No. 1, Op. 16 - Rhapsody for Violin and Piano.

Christine Wang, violin

Christine has been a member of the second violin section of New Zealand Symphony Orchestra since 2022. She holds a Bachelor of Music from Eastman School of Music and Master of Music at Rice University, studying under Oleh Krysa and Kathleen Winkler respectively. Before coming to New Zealand, Christine was Assistant Concertmaster of San Antonio Symphony and has worked in orchestras in the United States and Australia.

Rachel Thomson, piano

Rachel Thomson was born in Dunedin, New Zealand, and grew up in Wellington where she began her piano studies with her mother. She went on to study with Judith Clark, graduating from Victoria University of Wellington before continuing her studies at the Cleveland Institute of Music in the United States, where she gained a doctorate in piano performance. Rachel regularly performs with some of the country’s leading musicians. She has toured on numerous occasions for Chamber Music New Zealand and is a member of various chamber ensembles including the Koru Trio. She has worked as an orchestral pianist with the NZSO, Orchestra Wellington, and the Christchurch Symphony Orchestra. Rachel is also active as a teacher, adjudicator and accompanist, and is a music examiner for Trinity College London.
events.description:
16 - Rhapsody for Violin and Piano.
Christine Wang, violin Christine has been a member of the second violin section of New Zealand Symphony Orchestra since 2022.
Before coming to New Zealand, Christine was Assistant Concertmaster of San Antonio Symphony and has worked in orchestras in the United States and Australia.
She went on to study with Judith Clark, graduating from Victoria University of Wellington before continuing her studies at the Cleveland Institute of Music in the United States, where she gained a doctorate in piano performance.
She has toured on numerous occasions for Chamber Music New Zealand and is a member of various chamber ensembles including the Koru Trio.

events.name: It's in the Ballot - KCDC - Raumati Community Board - In-studio
events.venue: Matatua Road Kapiti, Wellington
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua-1 Whitmore Street #Level 4 Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua
events.venue: 1 Whitmore Street #Level 4 Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.long_description:
Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.
events.description:
Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.

Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.

events.id: Free Film Night : Perfect Days-100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Free Film Night : Perfect Days
events.venue: 100 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
”Perfect Days”
Date & Time: Thursday, 28 August 2025 – Time: 5:30 PM
Venue: Embassy of Japan, 100 Willis St, Wellington, Rating : M
Free admission
copyright:© 2023 Master Mind Ltd.
Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a toilet cleaner in Tokyo.
Outside his structured daily routine, he enjoys music, books, and photographing trees he loves.
A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more about his past. A deeply moving and poetic film about finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
Awards & Recognition
Best Actor (YAKUSHO Koji) – Cannes Film Festival 2023
Prize of the Ecumenical Jury – Cannes Film Festival 2023
Best Film – Asia Pacific Screen Awards
Japan Academy Prize for Best Actor
Nominated for Best International Feature Film – Academy Awards

events.id: Public Meeting: Affordable Healthcare for All - Wellington-211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Public Meeting: Affordable Healthcare for All - Wellington
events.venue: 211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Luxon’s cuts are making our health system worse. His choices are why it’s getting harder and more expensive to see a doctor or nurse. Because of Luxon’s underfunding, GP fees are heading towards $100. National has found hundreds of millions for tobacco companies while hospitals go understaffed and graduate nurses are left without jobs.
Labour will make it cheaper and easier to get care close to home, and make sure hospitals are there when you need them.
Join Labour Leader Chris Hipkins and spokesperson for health Dr Ayesha Verrall for a public meeting on getting the healthcare you deserve.
Public Meeting: Affordable Healthcare for All
Thursday 28 August, 6:00pm–7:30pm
St Peter’s Church on Willis Street

events.description:
Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.

events.id: Hurdle Film Screening-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Hurdle Film Screening
events.venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about Hurdle, screening on the 28th of August can be found at https://www.hurdlefilm.com/.

Three-hour beverage package
Three-course set menu
Flaming cocktail
Live entertainment

After a sell-out first go of it WE ARE BACK with our hit late night sketch comedy brought to you by RUFF AS GUTZ- a local theatre company behind the MILK saga, Hardly Workin'!, DOGS IN THE HOLE and other things, I'm sure.
This could be considered a curated scratch night. It could also be considered a low-budget SNL. One thing's for sure: It's happening and it's happening SOON.

Music from 9.30 until 11pm

events.id: The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz-Shady Lady, 66 Courtenay Plce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz
events.venue: Shady Lady, 66 Courtenay Plce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for a fun night of trivia and drinks at The Lot fundraiser Pub Quiz - let's raise some money together!

We are a bunch of Maessey University students and we need you help to fund our third year student film The Lot.

The film follows Riley and her boyfriend Jay, as they attempt to purchase snacks for a party. However, their arrogance and lack of communication turns a simple task into the unraveling of their relationship.
The film is a comical narrative that pokes fun at miscommunication and microaggression, and ends (literally) in a big mess. I hope audiences are able to share a laugh and see a bit of themselves in the characters: whether it’s the cashier who’s just trying to make it through his shift, or the partner who’s completely had it with their relationship.

events.name: The Wellington Food Show
events.venue: Sky Stadium, 105 Waterloo Qy
events.long_description:
Are you ready to reignite your passion for cooking and get inspired with new flavours? Then look no further than The Food Show, Wellington's ultimate foodie extravaganza! This isn’t just another trip to the market — it’s an immersive culinary adventure that will excite all your senses.

Prepare to witness culinary rockstars in action as they whip up their signature dishes live! Renowned chefs and culinary stars, including MasterChef winners Nadia Lim, Sam Low, and the hilarious Annabelle White, will be sharing their tips, tricks, and insider knowledge in the Chance Voight Cooking Theatre. Whether you’re looking to master a new dish or get ideas to elevate your meals, this is your chance to get inspired and bring restaurant-worthy meals into your own kitchen.

Beyond the live cooking demonstrations, The Food Show is packed with exclusive show specials you won’t want to miss. Stock up on pantry essentials at unbeatable prices, discover hidden gems from local producers, or indulge in luxurious gourmet treats — all while saving big on products you can’t find anywhere else.

Whether you're a seasoned chef or just getting started, The Food Show is your ticket to discovering the best in food, flavour, and fun.

What’s Included in Your HERA Collective Membership: 🌕 Focused, inspiring monthly gatherings in Nelson/Stoke — designed to connect, empower, and energise you 🌕 Access to our private online group — start building meaningful connections before you even walk into the room 🌕 Special offers, gift vouchers, and playful surprises throughout the year 🌕 Thoughtfully managed spaces — no cliques, no strangers, just real connection 🌕 A place to feel seen, heard, and uplifted — for who you are, not just what you do 🌕 A community that supports both your business growth and personal wellbeing If you’re like me, maybe you didn’t grow up here.

events.id: Dragons Is My Uso-Dragons Chinese Restaurant, 25 Tory St-WOAP
events.name: Dragons Is My Uso
events.venue: Dragons Chinese Restaurant, 25 Tory St
events.long_description:
Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!

events.id: Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys- Dufferin Street Wellington, Wellington-Event Brite
events.name: Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys
events.venue: Dufferin Street Wellington, Wellington
events.description:
This national conference is hosted by the influential Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation, in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across the world, and here in New Zealand, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom.
As educators, we play a pivotal role in improving the behaviour and engagement of boys.
If you are responsible for boys, teaching, coaching, providing care and working with boys, you will already know about the unique challenges they present in ways to manage their engagement and behaviour.
Matt is the co-director of the Center for Men and Boys at California State University.

events.id: Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference-Dufferin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Improving the Behaviour and Engagement of Boys Conference
events.venue: Dufferin Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6021, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Be part of a groundbreaking national conference, hosted by the Australian-based Positive Masculinity Foundation in collaboration with the Wellington College Research Centre.
Across Aotearoa and the world, many boys are feeling disengaged and excluded from the classroom. This event brings together educators, coaches, counsellors, and mentors for a day of meaningful conversations, keynote presentations, and practical breakout sessions focused on improving boys’ engagement, behaviour, and social connectedness.
Why attend?
Learn practical strategies to connect with boys and young men
Gain insights on classroom engagement, behaviour management, and building respect
Discover how to harness student culture and involve parents/whānau
Hear from world-class experts in education, leadership, and boys’ development
Speakers include:
Dr Ray Swann — Executive Director, Positive Masculinity Foundation
Dr Mark Dowley — Author, The Classroom Management Handbook
Kristen Molloy — Associate Head, The Crowther Centre
Ingrid Howren — Leadership Coach & +M Curriculum Specialist
Dr Aaron Columbus — Deputy Principal Teaching & Learning, Wellington College
Special Keynote: Professor Matt Englar-Carlson — Co-Director, Center for Men and Boys, California State University, leading expert on positive masculinity and mental health
Details:
Ticket includes morning tea & lunch
Accommodation advice available for out-of-town attendees (contact Dr Aaron Columbus at Wellington College)
This is a rare opportunity to learn from international leaders and collaborate with peers passionate about helping boys thrive.

Entry to Te Papa is free for all New Zealanders and people living in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Don’t miss out on our other whānau-friendly events!

events.id: Re-imagine Pōneke: Co-design our city-level 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Re-imagine Pōneke: Co-design our city
events.venue: level 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
What would Wellington look like if it truly reflected our hopes for a just, sustainable, and thriving city – not in 30 years, but right now?
Join us for Re-imagine Pōneke, a half-day unconference where Wellingtonians will come together to dream big, share ideas, and co-create a bold vision for the future of our city. Through participant-led breakout sessions and live illustration, we’ll collectively map out what a better Wellington could be – from housing and climate action to transport, community spaces, and beyond.
This event is part of Stronger Together, a youth-led campaign making local democracy real and relevant in Pōneke. As local elections approach, it’s time to reimagine how our city works for us all and explore the power of community-driven ideas.
Why come along?
Connect: Meet others who care deeply about the future of our city.
Create: Contribute your vision to a live, visual representation of a better Wellington.
Collaborate: Join participant-driven sessions on issues that matter most to you.
Inspire change: Leave with practical ideas and energy to take forward.
Whether you’re a seasoned organiser, new to local politics, or simply passionate about Wellington’s future, this event is for you.
🎟️ Tickets: Free and koha-based (pay what you can).
🥪 Kai: Limo pizzas!!
🗓️ Agenda: We make it up on the day - curious to know what this would look like? Check out the plan here

events.id: Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts-101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
events.venue: 101 Glenmore Street, Kelburn, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Letting Go: A ritual for fresh starts
If you’ve been through a redundancy, restructure, or a big shift in your working life - or if you’ve been out of work for a while and are looking ahead to something new - this gathering is for you.
We’ll spend an hour outdoors (weather permitting) in a gentle, guided ritual to help you release some of the heaviness that comes with change and open up to what’s next. You can expect moments of quiet reflection, light movement, and simple nature-based activities designed to connect you with yourself, the land, and a sense of possibility. There’s no chanting, costumes, or anything too out-there - just a safe, thoughtful space to mark what you’ve been through and welcome in the next chapter.
The ritual will be hosted by Tamara Buckland - Leadership Strategist, Chief People Officer, and Druid - who blends leadership wisdom with nature-based practices to create meaningful, accessible experiences for people in transition.
After the ritual, we’ll wander to Picnic Café for coffee or tea (you’ll just need to cover your own drink) for those who’d like to keep connecting.
Details
📅 Friday 29 August (rain date: Friday 5 September)
🕛 12:00–1:00pm ritual
☕ 1:00pm coffee/tea at Picnic Café
💸 Free (pay for your own drink at the café)
📍 Wellington - location shared on registration
This is for anyone ready to put down some of the weight they’ve been carrying, connect with nature and themselves, and make space for the next chapter.

events.venue: Main Street Greytown Town Centre – main Forum Greytown, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!-Royal Port Nicholson Yacht Club, 103 Oriental Pde, Oriental Bay, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!
events.venue: Royal Port Nicholson Yacht Club, 103 Oriental Pde, Oriental Bay, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.

events.id: Agatha Pantha and BDSN With A Side Of Don And Beans-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Agatha Pantha and BDSN With A Side Of Don And Beans
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers.
Fronted by singer and ukelele player Mo Blishen, and filled out with Kent Hogan on guitar, Nik Straughier on bass and Sam King on drums, Agatha Pantha is the product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the every day.
Joining them are fellow Wellington Band BDSN, fronted by Nigel Parry.
Satirical songs with a hard edge and soft centre, a bit like a box of chocolates.
Joined by Scott Pilgrim, Darrel Greaney and Ben McHardy.

events.id: CMNZ Series Takács Quartet-Public Trust Hall, 131-135, Lambton Quay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: CMNZ Series Takács Quartet
events.venue: Public Trust Hall, 131-135, Lambton Quay, Wellington
events.description:
Lauded for their recordings of Joseph Haydn’s 'String Quartets', the Takács Quartet will open their programme with Op.
74, No.
3, known as 'The Rider' – a reference to the galloping licks in the finale, and will finish with Ludwig van Beethoven’s glorious No.
59 No.
Between these two tōtara of the string quartet repertoire, the Takács Quartet will present a new work – 'Flow' by American solo violist and composer, Nokuthula Ngwenyama, that seeks to express the creation of the universe as it expanded out from a primeval atom 13.7 billion years ago.

events.id: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!-87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!
events.venue: 87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
Once each season, our beautifully historic local church is transformed into an intimate haven, softly illuminated by the glow of 200 flickering candles and a gentle wash of laser light.
The result?
Guest Artists: The Kugels Take two former New Zealand Symphony Orchestra players, a virtuoso accordionist, and a renowned bass player — and you have The Kugels!
After nationwide tours with Arts on Tour NZ and Chamber Music New Zealand, and performances at major festivals, The Kugels continue to enchant and inspire wherever they play.
Whether you come for the spellbinding music, the magical candlelit setting, or the sense of connection and community, we promise an evening you’ll never forget — and one you’ll want to return to, season after season.

events.id: World Chase Tag Casual Game Night-101 Kilbirnie Cres, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: World Chase Tag Casual Game Night
events.venue: 101 Kilbirnie Cres, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come play Chase Tag at the Kilbirnie Recreation Center.
Come along to our casual game sessions. These will be open to anyone wanting to play and will be social, casual based rather than keeping score. We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).
World Chase Tag was formed by Christian Devaux in 2012 after a game of Tag with his son in their back garden. A year later, he was joined by his brother, Damien, and together they set about turning the oldest game into the newest sport.

Cost:
-$4.50

events.name: Elton John vs Billy Joel Tribute Show
events.venue: Udy St Lower Hutt,
events.description:
New Zealand’s hit tribute show ‘Elton John vs. Billy Joel’ are back on the road as they announce their epic 2025 national tour!
New Zealand’s award-winning tribute show, Elton John vs. Billy Joel, is back for another epic national tour in 2025!
After captivating tens of thousands of concertgoers across the country with numerous spectacular Sell-out performances, in 2023 & 2024, Cam & Sam are taking their powerhouse show to even more towns and cities across New Zealand.
Over the past few years, Cam & Sam have delighted Elton John and Billy Joel fans nationwide, earning rave reviews and a loyal following.
This tribute show honours their legendary catalogue, featuring all the biggest hits, including Rocket Man, Piano Man, Uptown Girl, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, Crocodile Rock, Tiny Dancer, Don’t Let the Sun Go Down on Me, River of Dreams, We Didn’t Start the Fire, It’s Still Rock ‘n’ Roll to Me, and many more!

events.id: The Wellington Raw Comedy Quest 2025 FINAL-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wellington Raw Comedy Quest 2025 FINAL
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Presented by KiwiTicket and Wellington Comedy The capital's premier comedy competition.
Witness the rising stars in stand-up comedy before they hit the big time.
The stepping stone for many New Zealand comedians, the Raw Comedy Quest has brought forth new comedy talent from across the country, with heats in Christchurch, Wellington, Palmerston North and Auckland.
From six heats, the top 24 go to the semifinals, and the top 10 to the Wellington final.
2023 Wellington finalist Luke Tawi won the 2023 National Raw Comedy Quest, and 2024 Wellington finalist Chen Wang came runner up in the 2024 National Raw Comedy Quest, can the capital do it again?

events.id: Fizzwizard - the Return!!!-Jack Hackett's, 7/11 Dixon St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Fizzwizard - the Return!!!
events.venue: Jack Hackett's, 7/11 Dixon St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Aleister ‘Fizzwizard’ Campbell returns from Tamaki Makaurau (Auckland) to his hometown to inflict all manner of psychedelic-blues-joy upon the good people of Te-Upoko-o-te-Ika (Wellington).

Trained in a jazz conservatory then corrupted in dive bars and on the streets, Aleister James Campbell, with his evergreen love of Charlie Parker & Jimi Hendrix, is known for his spell-binding stage presence and deep connection to the music.

Currently on the run from the Jazz Police for inappropriate Wah Wah use in a straight-ahead jazz context...

For what promises to be a triumphant night, Aleister (on guitar and vocals) will be joined by: Tyson Smith - Electric Bass, Rick Cranson - Drum Kit, Baron Oscar Laven - Alto & Soprano Sax, and Jake Baxendale - Tenor Sax.

events.long_description:
Girls Rock the Boys is bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage. With Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, Jude Madill, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, and a stellar band backing them up, it's bound to be a night of high-energy performances.

This from our last gig...

"Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking - check them out!"

An electrifying time warp! The 70s were a golden era for rock, with bands like Journey, Led Zeppelin, Whitesnake, and Deep Purple defining the sound of an entire generation. The idea of powerhouse female vocalists fronting a live band, belting out classics from these legends, is pure magic.

Early bird tickets are just $20, while door sales are $30—so it's definitely worth grabbing them early. This show is going to be an absolute blast, so securing those cheaper tickets ahead of time is a smart move.

events.name: 2nd Anniversary Party
events.venue: 63 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jungle Juice: 2nd Anniversary Party
FRIDAY 29TH AUGUST • 9PM–3AM • THE GARDEN HOTEL - WELLINGTON
We’re turning 2 years old, and we want to celebrate with all of you! We’ve been bringing you beach parties and raves for 2 years and we’re not slowing down. It’s also DJ By Accident’s birthday, so we’re throwing a massive jungle rave filled with a multicoloured line-up from house to techno at The Garden Hotel.
LINE-UP:
• NOT MY SISTER - HOUSE
• DJ BY ACCIDENT- AFRO-LATIN /HOUSE
• GASPAR - BOUNCE SINGALONG TECHNO
• MALWARE - HARD TECHNO
Dress code: Party Animals (think jungle creatures, leopard, snakeskin, zebra, cheetah. Get wild!)
See you in the jungle!
***Please Respect the Venue***
*** Important Information ***
At Jungle Juice we will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Remember we all come from different walks of life and we don’t know what others have/are going through. Never judge anyone on who they are.
We share our time with you in a loving and respectful way and we want everyone to feel this every minute they are at a jungle juice event.
Consent is key – always.
Have fun and please find us at the decks if you have any issues.

events.id: Create Your Own Coffee Blend-Shed 13, 37 Customhouse Quay-WOAP
events.name: Create Your Own Coffee Blend
events.venue: Shed 13, 37 Customhouse Quay
events.long_description: Join Mojo's team of coffee experts for this hands-on specialty coffee tasting and blending workshop at their iconic roastery on Wellington's waterfront. Experts will showcase the world's flavours through single-origin coffees and help you create your own custom blend to take home. Learn about the farmers Mojo work with, different coffee growing regions and why each coffee is so unique. Hosted by Mojo's highly experienced coffee specialists, their head roaster will also give you an up-close demonstration of the roasting process and explain what it takes to make the perfect blend. Drinks and nibbles provided.

SLIPKNOT – by The Feeders THE PRODIGY – by The Firestarters NIRVANA – by The Neverminds GREEN DAY – by GreenGaze MARILYN MANSON – by The Antichrist Superstar PLUS a full-noise performance from heavyweights KAOSIS.

DJ ApenuT (Nu Metal) DJ Subpop (Grunge) Wall to wall riffs, raw energy, and nothing but attitude.
This is the hard rock night Upper Hutt’s been waiting for.

events.description:
Take a walk back in time to enjoy some of the most famous music of the 60s and 70s.
Creedence Clearwater Revival was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972 the band produced some highly memorable songs.
Many of them are still regularly played today.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective recreates the success of the original band.

events.name: Makers and Shakers

events.long_description:
Makers and Shakers is back for 2025. Indulge in three one-of-a-kind love potions, each masterfully crafted by the talented team at Cuckoo Emporium and served in a unique ceramic vessel. These beautiful, handmade pieces come from the skilled local potters of the Wellington Potters Association. As you sip and savour your delicious concoctions, listen to the shakers tell their love stories behind their potions and the makers speak the sonnets of their creations. Your ticket includes three alcoholic cocktails, light snacks and three bespoke ceramic pieces to take home.
 
 (*Pottery shown are the vessels from the 2024 event and will be different this year)

events.id: Cafe Fund Raiser Event for SPCA with Puppy Cuddles-Greta Point Cafe, 326 Evans Bay Parade, Evans Bay, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cafe Fund Raiser Event for SPCA with Puppy Cuddles
events.venue: Greta Point Cafe, 326 Evans Bay Parade, Evans Bay, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Hi, I’m Daniela, proud owner of Greta Point Cafe in Evans Bay and a passionate animal lover! I’m thrilled to announce a special SPCA fundraiser at my cafe on Saturday, 30 August 2025 to support animals in need.

Join us for a fun-filled day featuring :
**Special bakery treats for dogs and humans alike,
**Puppy cuddles (10am- 2pm) from puppies currently living at the SPCA shelter
** Opportunities to donate to the SPCA.

In the lead-up to the event, we’re also collecting donations like pet food, blankets, and other supplies—feel free to drop them off at Greta Point Cafe, and we’ll deliver them to the SPCA on the day.

This fundraiser is a tribute to the memory of my beloved dog, who I got from SPCA when I first moved to Wellington and is also a way to help animals still waiting for their forever homes.

Let’s come together to make this fundraiser a success and give animals the love and care they deserve!

events.name: Winter Women's Workshop
events.venue: 107 Field Way, Waikanae Beach 5036, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Winter Women's Workshop | Seasons of Self & The Sauna Project Kāpiti
Saturday, August 30th | Waikanae
Embrace the elements with an outdoor yoga session followed by a sauna to warm you up, and reconnect with yourself at our nourishing Winter Women’s Workshop — a unique seasonal experience hosted by Seasons of Self & The Sauna Project Kāpiti.
Join us for a 2-hour guided session of soul-deep restoration and connection, with two session times available:
⏰9:00am – 11:00am
⏰10:00am – 12:00pm
Each workshop includes:
💨Guided breathwork
🧘🏻‍♀️Gentle yoga + meditation
🌱Nervous system education
🥣 Nutrition for winter wellness
🔥 Guided Sauna Sessions
✨Heartfelt conversation in a small, supportive group
This is a chance to slow down, warm up, and honour your natural rhythm in the stillness of winter. Whether you're craving nervous system support, seasonal nourishment, or simply a moment to breathe, this experience is for you.
Please bring: a towel, water bottle, and yoga mat.
Limited spots available | $69 per person
Book early to secure your place.
We can’t wait to share this space with you!

events.id: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Your Life’s Purpose – Discover Your Emotional Needs and Core Values
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
Let the emotional knowledge you gain inform not only how you live your life but also how you feel about living it.
To do this you’ll identify your values hierarchy and learn about how this framework can inform how you live your life.
Once you can apply a spirit of consistency to your self-identified larger purpose, as well as your needs, then your life’s purpose, emotional needs and core values, will align.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Develop a Life Purpose Statement Perform an Emotional Needs Self-Assessment Elicit Your Core Values Align your goals with your life purpose, emotional needs and core values Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Bike Maintenance for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Bike Maintenance for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride.
Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course.
Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.
If you have the following, please bring them as well:  A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Name most parts of a bicycle correctly - Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle - Fix a flat tyre - Adjust your bike to fit your body - Oil and clean your chain - Identify and fix some common brake problems Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

Cooking: Lentils – Types, Recipes and How to Cook Them The lentil is perhaps the world’s most versatile and indestructible food.

Enjoy this half-day course that will show you how to cook lentils properly and make the most of this nutritious staple ingredient.
Discover spices to complement and enhance lentils and create some mouth-watering dishes.

events.long_description:
The Creepy Cute Market Returns to Wellington!
Get ready, Wellington — the Creepy Cute Market is coming back to town!
When: Saturday, 30 August 2025, 9:30am – 2:30pm
Where: Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Indulge your love for the weird, whimsical, and wonderfully wicked at a market where spooky meets sweet. After a hauntingly successful run last time, we're thrilled to return with even more delightfully dark treasures for all you macabre-loving misfits.
Expect:
Spine-tingling art & prints
Spooktacular fashion & accessories
Morbidly cute homewares
Handcrafted oddities by local makers
And everything your gothic heart desires
Whether you're a long time lover of the bizarre or just creepily curious, this market is for you. Meet fellow oddity enthusiasts, shop from passionate creators, and embrace your spooky side in the heart of Wellington.
Free entry | All ages welcome | Costumes encouraged!
Don’t miss the return of the Creepy Cute Market — it's going to be wicked fun.

events.name: Intro To Standup Comedy
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Have you always wanted to try stand-up comedy?
Or do you just want to learn how to be a funnier, more confident speaker?
Let's get you started in this fun, interactive one-day workshop.
No experience, preparation, or talents required!
In this class you will learn to: Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines Maximize laughter with great delivery Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Intro to Standup Comedy In this class you will learn to: Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines Maximize laughter with great delivery Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.

events.id: Knitting - Next Level-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Knitting - Next Level
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Knitting - Next Level Build on your learning from the Beginner’s Knitting class.
Learn how to read a knitting ball band and knitting pattern as well as gain a basic understanding of knitting abbreviations.
You will have practiced the wraps per inch method, practiced a couple of techniques as outlined by knitting abbreviations and understand tension as both a principle and practical guide in the craft of knitting.
By the end of the session you’ll be able to: Read a knitting ball band Know how to determine yarn weight using the wraps per inch method Read a basic knitting pattern Run through of basic knitting abbreviations (reference sheet provided) Understand tension: what is it, why you make tension swatches and how to alter tension as needed.
Explore the rules of substituting yarn Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Oil Painting Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Oil Painting Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Oil Painting Workshop In this course we will learn about painting with oils: one of the oldest and most interesting mediums, and one which has an undeserved reputation for being slow or intimidating!
In this workshop we will learn some quick methods for getting started in oils, using “alla prima” (wet on wet) methods to develop an understanding of the painting process.
In addition to learning about the practical side of the medium, there will also be opportunities to learn a bit about the extraordinary history of painting in oils.
Basic paint colours provided, you're welcome to bring along any that you may already have at home.
- Develop transparent glazes and washes over your painting.

events.id: Women's Health and Aging Workshop-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Women's Health and Aging Workshop
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $109 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
The objective of this workshop is to give you knowledge and understanding about how you can manage the effects on your health and wellbeing as we age as women.
Trunk stability versus core strength as we age and the impact on our other core muscles and pelvic floor will be discussed.
-The importance of the diaphragm and breathing well will also be discussed to enhance optimal movement and function for women.
Please wear comfortable clothes and socks as this is an interactive workshop, and bring a yoga mat or beach towel.

events.id: Zine Making - Introduction-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Zine Making - Introduction
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Zine Making - Introduction In this workshop you will be guided in making a classic cut and fold 8-page zine from a standard A4 sheet of paper - this is a clever design you can easily photocopy and reproduce later!
You will be introduced to a range of techniques and approaches such as cut and paste photos and text, collage and drawing on paper.
Paper, newspapers, magazines and basic drawing materials will be provided.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: Cut and fold a classic 8-page zine format from a single sheet of paper Brainstorm content ideas for your personalised zine publications Arrange & compose text and images to fit a classic 8-page zine layout Combine cut & paste magazine content with hand drawn/ written content Create a draft zine of your personal interests Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.id: 4 Week Zine Club-Fareham Creative Space, 80 Underhill Rd, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: 4 Week Zine Club
events.venue: Fareham Creative Space, 80 Underhill Rd, Featherston
events.description:
This is a four-week workshop introducing participants to the creative world of zine and chapbook making, with a focus on design, developing your content, and hands-on creation.
Over the course of four sessions (and optional homework), each attendee will produce one self-published 8-page zine or chapbook of their own design.
Participants are encouraged to explore a wide range of creative possibilities.
By the end of the four weeks, everyone will have a finished, self-published zine or chapbook to keep, share, or distribute.
Please note: printing and distribution costs are not included in the workshop and will be the responsibility of each participant.

events.venue: Percy Cameron Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region
events.description:
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making, leading to work that is expressive and real.
From there, the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.
Please visit this LINK to know more about the event.
With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry, Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor.
He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop, contributing to major films and exhibitions, and has worked across materials, scales, and digital technologies.

events.id: Plant Sale-34 St Johns Ter, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Plant Sale
events.venue: 34 St Johns Ter, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale.

events.id: Spring Container Planting Workshop-2 Forresters Ln, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Spring Container Planting Workshop
events.venue: 2 Forresters Ln, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Grow Your Own Kai - In Containers From Your Own Compost
Want to grow your own fresh kai but only have a balcony, patio, or courtyard? This hands-on workshop will show you how to grow spring vegetables and herbs in containers - a flexible, low-cost way to turn even the smallest space into a productive garden. Following on from our winter edition, this is the second workshop in our seasonal container growing series, with a focus on getting your spring garden thriving using your own compost.
This workshop will cover:
- What to grow in spring, including leafy greens, herbs, and root vegetables
- How to set up containers - choosing the right size, drainage, potting mix, and using your own compost or bokashi soil
- Feeding your plants with DIY fertilisers, spotting nutrient gaps, and refreshing tired soil
- Creating ideal growing conditions with sunlight, watering tips, wind protection, and natural pest control
- Keeping your garden productive by harvesting, replanting, and rotating crops throughout the season
Please bring your own container(s) - buckets, storage bins, flexi tubs, or old drawers all welcome. We will show you how to safely repurpose them.

A catalyst for the growth and development of Wellington artists

For more information head to the Toi Pōneke website.

BootyBasics - The Ultimate Twerk Foundations Class Designed for Beginners (all levels welcome)
Hot & Hype addition? Think Nicki, think Megan, think Cardi think hype girl and upbeat!
Get ready to connect with your hips and move your body in a fun and unique way to all of our favourit Hot Girl tracks.
BootyBasics will bring out your confidence and the inner baddie that's inside all of us! This workshop will have you embracing your body and feeling STRONG from the inside out.
🍑 Learn Core Twerk Movements - we will breakdown booty pops, booty Shaki, whining your waistline, twerking on all 4's to name a few!
🍑 Boost Confidence - Step into your power, own your movements and leave on a twerking high!!
🍑 Learn a Bootylicious Choreography - We will end this class with a hype girl chory that you can take home and add to your repertoire.
🍑 Tone & Strengthen - Engage your core, legs and glutes for a sculpting session that feels more like a party than a workout!
🍑 Unleash Your Energy - Shake off that stagnant energy, ignite your inner fire and learn to move in a unique way!
🍑 No Dance Experience? No worries! I will teach you everything you need to know and all levels are welcome.
BootyBasics is your chance to step out of your comfort zone, connect with your hips through movement and get in touch with your innner booty shaking goddess!
I can't wait to shake with you sis❤️
Terms & Conditions
In attending my classes, i trust that you are in a good health condition and that you know of no medical or other reason why you cannot or should not engage in active or passive exercise. I film and/or photograph classes. Please tell me prior to class that you do not want to be filmed as it is possible that you will appear in these materials. If you do not let me know you do not wish to be filmed, by accepting this agreement, you allow me the unrestricted right and permission to use your image in printed or digital promotional materials including, but not limited to: websites, social media, flyers, banners and videos. Please note that I use videographers of all genders and my partner will sometimes be present to film content. I will only ever use people I trust to film my classes.
Although my main target audience is female please note my classes are for all genders.

Much love,
Molly xx

events.id: Creative Power - Nelson Workshop NEW DATE-Main Road Stoke Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
events.name: Creative Power - Nelson Workshop NEW DATE
events.venue: Main Road Stoke Nelson, Nelson Region
events.description:
This is more than a workshop – it’s a chance to connect, learn, and be part of the movement.
The Creative Power workshop series is travelling across Aotearoa to bring together Writers, Directors, Editors and Performers to unpack the Screen Industry Workers Act (SIWA), share knowledge, and build stronger screen careers — together.
Delivered in partnership with NZWG, DEGANZ and Equity NZ, these free workshops offer the tools and insights you need to feel confident in your work and your rights.
What we’ll cover:🛠️ Practical tools for getting contracts right now📜 The story behind SIWA – how we got here and why it matters💬 Demystifying bargaining – what it means for you🧠 Discussion, questions and shared experiences🍷 Drinks, nibbles, and the chance to connect with your creative whānau You won’t want to miss this.
Whether you’re just starting out or a seasoned pro, this is your chance to get informed, feel empowered, and spend time with fellow creatives who get it.

events.id: Wellington Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds-Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds
events.venue: Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.description:
Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants.
By the end of the workshop you will: - understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting - feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants - know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits - know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging - know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor - feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.
Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.
To learn more about Felicity and her offerings, visit @wildbotanica.nz on social media or www.wildbotanica.co.nz.
For any queries, please email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.

events.id: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk-Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Our Beloved Indigenous Vegetation - Guided Walk
events.venue: Wellington Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this approximately one-hour downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on several native plants from the ubiquitous, such as our well-known cabbage tree, kōwhai and podocarps, to lesser-knowns such as shrubby toroaro/mingimingi, Bartlett's rātā, Three Kings kaikōmako and Three Kings vine/akapukaea. We will also discuss the phenomenon of species radiation exemplified by Hebe and Kauri.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Greg Crayford's Jazz Night - Twenty Year Anniversary!-7 Moxham Ave, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Greg Crayford's Jazz Night - Twenty Year Anniversary!
events.venue: 7 Moxham Ave, Hataitai, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Twenty years! Yep, you read that right. This residency has run for two solid decades.
Greg Crayford here. Host and drummer of what’s been billed for some time now as Wellington’s Longest-Running Jazz Residency. And rightly so! Little could we have known when this gig began at The Realm in Hataitai in August 2005 that it’d still be going in 2025. It’s a fantastic achievement. Longer residencies have occurred in our town but nothing currently running holds a candle to that sort of effort by a single artist, at a single venue, in this town (and possibly beyond).
We boast quite the legacy: two Tui-nominated live albums, several bar owners, many managers and staff, hundreds of featured professional musicians and young artists, 500-odd gigs, uncountable numbers of pizzas, beer, whisky, and much laughter and joy. From local music students to top-notch international artists we’ve seen it all.
It’s a huge milestone - 20 years of high quality music played by a massive variety of talented people.
The exciting programme is largely finalised and is pasted below.
Mark the date!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want? How about twenty years of quality music?
Sure hope to see you there

events.id: Monthly Life Drawing-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Monthly Life Drawing
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
Students will practice making simple textured or polished bracelets in either copper or brass, then move on to making a silver bracelet.
They will learn measuring, texturing, soldering, and finishing techniques to make beautiful, lasting, wearable bangles!
Workshop fee includes materials for the basic project.

events.venue: Brackenridge Country Retreat & Spa, White Rock Rd, Martinborough
events.description:
Discover local creativity at The Brackenridge Art Show!
Our main conference centre and day spa lounge transform into a pop-up gallery filled with Wairarapa art, pottery, jewellery, ceramics, sculptures and more — all available for purchase.
Entry is free, and every visitor goes in the draw to win one of 3 door prizes: either a 3-month gym membership, a luxurious spa voucher, or a night’s accommodation in a Brackenridge Studio.

It’s the perfect way to spend a relaxed afternoon in style.

events.id: It's in the Ballot-HCC - Saturday 30th August Production Day Pass-In-studio-Queen Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot-HCC - Saturday 30th August Production Day Pass-In-studio
events.venue: Queen Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: Capturing te Hīkoi-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Capturing te Hīkoi
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
30th Aug. Join Te Waka Huia and renowned photographer Te Rawhitiroa Bosch for an illustrated kōrero about his mahi documenting te Hīkoi Mō te Tiriti (March for the Treaty) activations against the Treaty Principles Bill.
Hear how Te Rawhitiroa and his colleagues used photography to shape the narrative of the hīkoi.
Learn how photography can uphold mana, protect the truth, and support kaupapa Māori storytelling.
Nau mai, haere mai!
Bring your friends and whānau and be part of this important kōrero.

events.id: Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+-13 Maida Vale Road, Roseneath, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+
events.venue: 13 Maida Vale Road, Roseneath, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
🎵 Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit!
🎵 Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View!
Helene Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing: Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello JS Bach – Sonata No.
The Comfy Concert series 2 Building on the success of the first series of Comfy Concerts from April to June, Helen and Rolf have announced another four concerts to benefit Kaibosh (Saturday 20 September & Saturday 15 November) and Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 20 August & Saturday 18 November).

events.id: Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+-13 Maida Vale Rd, Roseneath, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Comfy Concert 5 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+
events.venue: 13 Maida Vale Rd, Roseneath, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
� Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.5 with Bridget Douglas (flute) and Victoria Jaenecke (viola) on August 30, 2025, playing:
Tabea Squire - Daydream and Dance for violin and cello
JS Bach – Sonata No. 1 in G minor for violin solo
Heitor Villa-Lobos – The Jet Whistle for flute and cello
WA Mozart – Flute Quartet in D Major
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.

events.id: JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon-12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa August @ The Welsh Dragon
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Ter, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We will be having our August Brewkaiwa at The Welsh Dragon, a cosy and quirky pub nestled in the heart of the city. With its warm atmosphere, distinctive character, and range of drinks on offer, it’s the perfect spot to relax, chat, and connect.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
events.description:
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa!
Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!

events.name: CHEERS DAD!
events.venue: 4b Sheffield Street, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Come along for an afternoon creative session of painting a piece of pottery for Dad - or with Dad, whilst sipping on your choice of brew.
This is your opportunity to get sorted for Father's Day (Father's Day NZ is Sun 7th September).
Book a ticket for yourself, your family and your dad, enjoy a creative session altogether, each turning a mug or tumbler into work of Picasso. No family dramas just a fun old time.
If Dad can't make it, make him a custom gift. Bring along your partner or your beer loving bestie!
You will be guided through the process of painting (let's get our facts straight its actually underglaze not paint!) your Mug/Tumbler. Dad will treasure his custom made piece or you could make matching family mugs!
This Pottery painting workshop is absolutely suitable for anyone...even the least creative people!
Ticket price includes:




Your own ceramic Mug/Tumbler ready for decorating


One Beverage (Beer or non alcoholic)


All the materials needed


Guidance from me to create a piece Dad will treasure forever


1 Kiln firing ~ this makes the piece strong, shiny and food and drink safe

events.venue: Tonic Bistro, 8 Kitchener Street, Martinborough
events.description:
Michael, owner and bartender at Tonic, loves two things in equal measure (pun intended) – cocktails and history.
He’ll offer up some of each in this class.
Shaken or stirred?
Olive or with a twist?
He’ll get back to the roots of some of our favourite drinks and help you make three of your own.

events.id: Queensgate Night Market-Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Queensgate Night Market
events.venue: Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt
events.description:
What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations.
The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 30th of August 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers.
It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

events.id: Cooking - Gourmet Sausage Making-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking - Gourmet Sausage Making
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
ooking: Gourmet Sausage Making Come along and learn how to fill sausage casings with a tasty mincemeat and get tips and tricks on how to make your own customized sausage mixes at home with the use of various herbs and spices.
Everyone will get some sausages to take home and enjoy.
All ingredients included in course fee but please bring your apron, a dish cloth and a couple of tea towels to the session.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Recognise how to handle a knife safely - Understand food safety and hygiene around sausage-making and avoiding cross contamination - Recognise the difference between two kinds of sausage casings and why you use each of them - Have some ideas on how to make and cook a good quality sausage properly - Be able to safely store sausages products Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Drizzle Sizzle - Karahui & Blue Earth Estate-Karahui Wine Bar & Eatery, 1 Memorial Square, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Drizzle Sizzle - Karahui & Blue Earth Estate
events.venue: Karahui Wine Bar & Eatery, 1 Memorial Square, Martinborough
events.description:
Each oil will be paired with small, thoughtfully prepared tasting dishes from Karahui that draw from Asian culinary traditions—designed to highlight unexpected yet compelling flavour combinations.
Karahui Wine Bar & Restaurant will host a collaborative tasting evening with Blue Earth Estate, highlighting the versatility of locally produced olive oil and wine alongside bold, umami-driven Asian cuisine.
The event will include a guided olive oil tasting featuring Blue Earth’s extra virgin oils, paired with a custom-designed tasting menu from Karahui that explores how Asian flavours interact with olive oil.
The experience will conclude with a wine flight from Blue Earth, showcasing thoughtful pairings that complement the dishes.
The focus is on education and enjoyment, celebrating local producers while introducing guests to unique cross-cultural flavour pairings in a relaxed, shared setting.

events.id: Bride Of The Year 2025-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Bride Of The Year 2025
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
events.long_description:
For 55 years, Wairarapa Bride of the Year has been a mainstay in the events calendar in the region. The event returns to the Wairarapa Events Centre for 2025, where brides who were married between 1 July and 30 June and were married in the Wairarapa, and/or have lived or are living in the Wairarapa, and/or whose spouse has lived in the Wairarapa, will get the chance to relive the magic of their big day, donning their gowns again, all while raising much needed funds for Te Awhina Plunket Wairarapa.

This event is unique in its focus on Wairarapa’s flourishing wedding industry. It is a great opportunity for couples planning their own weddings to look for inspiration from other local couples, for friends and families of brides to reminisce on the weddings. It is also an excellent opportunity to support Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.

In 2024, the funds raised through Bride of the Year went towards purchasing equipment for use for Plunket rooms across Wairarapa along with purchase .

A ticket to Bride of the Year provides you with a night of glamour and celebration of love, all while supporting Wairarapa Plunket and the service they provide to our community.
