events.id: Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI-34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mexican Prehispanic Experience at AWHI
events.venue: 34 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Claudio in his Mexican project called Xochipilli´s Eye. Xochipilli (Pronounce: Zo-chee-pee-lee) is the Mexica god of music, flowers, arts, and sacred plants.
Claudio´s last trip home to Mexico was full of inspiration, reconnecting him to his ancestral roots in Mexico City. He was fortunate to meet a prehispanic musician and instrument maker who plays and crafts beautiful traditional instruments. Claudio returned to NZ with many special new instruments; and continues to be inspired and guided by the cultural wealth, wisdom, and knowledge of the ancient cultures of the Americas.
This event will be extraordinary and unique. You will learn about Mexican prehispanic cosmology and spirituality. Experience simple and powerful rituals together with unique musical instruments used by Olmecs, Toltecs, Aztecs, and Mayans. The instruments include clay flutes, clay drums, medicine drums, ocarinas, wooden flutes, shells, and shakers skilfully arranged to create magical shamanic atmospheres.
We will be sharing Cacao which is an energetic traditional Mexican prehispanic drinks that help open the heart, reconnect with the earth element, ignite your fire, and get you up and moving.
What to expect:
Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.
Talk about the use of music in the ancient times.
An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions.
Cacao ceremony: Claudio will offer the cacao drink as a connection with the earth, to yourself, and the moment.
Live music that invokes many emotions and imagery, from contemplative natural and mystical environments to uplifting and empowering rhythms. You are free to project and explore within and/ or express and liberate projecting outwards.
We will finish with a shamanic atmosphere relaxation and close the event with a traditional chant.
No previous experience is required.
What to bring:
Wear comfortable clothing! Bring an open heart and a mind ready to learn and receive. You are also welcome to bring a fruit and or a flower to contribute to the altar.
Date & Time: Saturday, April 13th, 6-7:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment: $55

events.id: Threads of Harmony: An Evening With Vocal FX and Friends-8 Duncan St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Threads of Harmony: An Evening With Vocal FX and Friends
events.venue: 8 Duncan St, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Vocal FX is a group spanning over 20 years of growth, success, and change. This concert is inspired by the themes of the 2025 National Barbershop Convention He Awa Whiria, weaving the braids of connection within our barbershop community like a river braid.
Throughout its history, Vocal FX has sewn threads of connection far and wide; we plan to highlight some of these relationships across the evening, while acknowledging the changes we are making to who we are, from within.
This concert will feature songs acknowledging the past, recognising new beginnings, and looking into the future, with who we strive to become.
Thank you to everyone new and old on this journey with us, we are looking forward to performing with, and for, all of you.

Bringing together three incredibly accomplished artists: Amalia Hall (violin), Callum Hall (guest cello) and Somi Kim (piano), every NZTrio performance powerfully reaffirms the importance and cathartic nature of a live musical experience in today’s digital world.
Chen Yi's Tibetan Tunes creates a fusion of traditional Tibetan melodies referencing Buddhist god Du Mu, before the premiere of Angelus, a new commission by one of Aotearoa’s most acclaimed composers, John Psathas.
1 in F sharp minor is as charming and intimate as it is powerful and explosive.
The programme Joaquín Turina | Circulo Shostakovich | Piano Trio No.1 in C minor Chen Yi | Tibetan Tunes John Psathas | Angelus César Franck | Piano Trio No.1 in F sharp minor Companion tickets available

events.id: The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith-Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith
events.venue: Moon, 167 Riddiford Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
THE COWPOKERS: Foot-tappin' Onekaka Swamp Rock, World Famous in Golden Bay!

Golden Bay's finest local boys are rounding up and riding North to bring their unique brand of rock, blues and ska to the capital. What if swamp rock wasn't born in Louisiana, but in Takaka you ask? What if Iggy Pop and the Stooges had been Marlborough dairy farmers? What if Hendrix had settled in a Tukurua art gallery selling homemade jewellery crafted from shells and bone? The answer to all these questions and more can be found at a Cowpokers gig: a raw, barn-storming, rural-rock-and-roll sensation that 23 years of gigging has utterly failed to hone, polish, or refine.

TYSON SMITH: Wellington-based guitarist/singer/songwriter Tyson Smith will be bringing his unique, original music combining elements of rock, blues, folk, world music and freeform improvisation.

Tyson has worked as a guitarist with acts ranging from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra to vocalist Hollie Smith, before focusing on his own music in the last few years.
In 2024 he celebrated 10 years since the release of his album The Hollow Tree with Rick Cranson and Ed Zuccollo, and released his new single Wolves. Tyson has been performing regularly around various New Zealand venues and festivals with his raw and exciting sound both with the trio and solo (utilising multiple amps and a bass drum).

Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. No rules, no rush - just tunes pumping, trays piling up, and that warm, familiar feeling of a proper brunch done right.

events.id: We 💛 Mac 'n' Cheese-Everybody Eats at LTD., 60 Dixon St-WOAP
events.name: We 💛 Mac 'n' Cheese
events.venue: Everybody Eats at LTD., 60 Dixon St
events.long_description:
A feast with purpose, where every bowl makes a difference.
Celebrate the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate and the end of winter with the ultimate comfort food: mac 'n' cheese, served all day long.

Two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh, are joining forces to serve piping hot mac 'n' cheese, raising funds to help feed the community. As official charity partners of the festival, they are turning comfort food into real impact.

For just $10, each bowl will help fund a three-course meal for someone in need through Everybody Eats or provide a day’s worth of food for a family via Kaibosh.

Customise your mac with a range of toppings and flavours, all made from rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. In the lead-up to the event, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh will be calling on their social media followers to share their favourite mac 'n' cheese combos, with the top picks featured on the day.

Diners can enjoy their meal seated in the Everybody Eats restaurant or opt for takeaway to share with the whānau or flat.

The goal is to serve 2,000 bowls and fund 2,000 meals for the community. Join the celebration, enjoy incredible kai and help make a real difference.

events.id: Love Language-Lustre Kitchen and Dining, 7-13 Seaview Road-WOAP
events.name: Love Language
events.venue: Lustre Kitchen and Dining, 7-13 Seaview Road
events.long_description:
Calling budding poets and hopeless romantics - this is your opportunity to share your love of language, with a food and poetry degustation. 
This four-course dinner is a physical manifestation of love and an ode to food. Join Simon Sweetman, Wellington writer, critic, musician and poet, as he reads some of his own poetry, and yours too if you're feeling game. Chefs Tim and Aaron Banks will lovingly create a four-course dinner with ingredients locally sourced and lovingly produced by small scale sustainable farmers... and perhaps they will read their own poems too. 
If you're feeling poetic bring along your own poem specially crafted around this year's festival theme 'Food is Love'. It can be as long or short as you like, as happy or sad, comical or tragic, Keats or Bukowski. Spot prizes for various categories including 'Most Related to the Theme' and 'Most Obviously Foodie' poems. Includes four courses, and a welcome glass of bubbles on arrival.

events.id: Leadlight Glass - 4 Weeks Spring Block-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Leadlight Glass - 4 Weeks Spring Block
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
This great course runs from Monday 31 August for 4 weeks until Monday 21 September, 10am-1pm.
Your 4-week block will give you time to learn the basics and then create one or more leadlight projects.
This class is ideal for creating sun-catchers or small decorative projects for beginners, or working on slightly more complex pieces for those with some experience.
This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students.
Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee, extra materials will be available for purchase if you wish to make larger pieces or more than one project.

events.id: Petals & Pastries: Roses & Rosè-1023 Longbush Road, Masterton-Facebook
events.name: Petals & Pastries: Roses & Rosè
events.venue: 1023 Longbush Road, Masterton
events.long_description:
Celebrate winter’s quiet beauty in the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse with a luxurious afternoon of flower-making and indulgence. In this guided workshop, you’ll learn how to craft stunning crepe paper roses — from gently curling petals to forming elegant buds and assembling your own everlasting bouquet. As you create, enjoy a spread of fresh pastries alongside a glass of blushing rosé wine. With the soft light of the garden outside and the warmth of good company within, this is a joyful, hands-on way to embrace the season and take home handmade blooms.
Date & Time: Sunday 31st August - 10am-1pm
Location: 1023 Longbush Road, Longbush 5884
(20 min scenic drive from Martinborough)
Price: $129

events.id: It's in the Ballot - WCC – Te Whanganui-a-Tara Māori Ward -In-studio- Hutchison Road Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - WCC – Te Whanganui-a-Tara Māori Ward -In-studio
events.venue: Hutchison Road Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative.
We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.

events.id: She Rises : Spring Edition- Johnston Street  Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: She Rises : Spring Edition
events.venue: Johnston Street  Wellington, Wellington Region
events.description:
When was the last time you truly paused?
This intimate gathering is for the women who: Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
You Will Leave With: ✨ Clarity on your path for the season ahead 🔥 Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power 🦋 The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love 🛠️ Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.

events.id: She Rises: A Spring Awakening-14 Johnston St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: She Rises: A Spring Awakening
events.venue: 14 Johnston St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ready to shake off the winter chill and awaken your inner power?
Escape the daily hustle and join us for an uplifting afternoon designed to rejuvenate your energy and unleash your creativity!
She Rises: A Spring Awakening is an immersive experience for wāhine where you will:
Gently release any self doubt, exhaustion or stored tension of the past season
Activate the CONFIDENCE and CLARITY that is already within you
Deeply connect with your intuition & soul led guidance
Through gentle movement, powerful mindset work and guided manifestation, you'll leave feeling grounded, inspired and ready to make this next season your most purposeful one yet.
If your soul is whispering for a chance to reconnect and recharge, this is your sign.
Date: Sunday, 31st August
Time: 12:30pm - 3:30pm
Location: AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Early bird tickets are limited. Tap the link to book your spot and welcome the spring with intention!
*Please note* - This workshop is not organised by AWHI Yoga so tickets are only available through the Eventbrite link below!
Facilitated by Sina Mikaio leadership coach, speaker, and facilitator who helps high-achieving women let go of perfectionism and ‘hustle’ culture that leads to burnout.

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: Jess and Cam-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: Jess and Cam
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.

events.id: Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle-7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Embody Your Flow - Reconnect to the wisdom of your menstrual cycle
events.venue: 7 Colombo St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Explore how to recognise your body’s rhythms, needs and strengths throughout your menstrual cycle, and discover supportive practices grounded in somatic and embodied awareness.
Attuning to the wisdom of the menstrual cycle offers a meaningful way to honour your natural rhythms, nurturing ease, creativity, and deeper connection.
This course is trauma-informed and inclusive. No prior somatics experience is necessary, and all who menstruate are welcome.
****************
Bookings:
https://www.trybooking.com/nz/events/landing/16754?embed
Or email amyeliserichards@gmail.com
Ticket prices range from $50-$75. If finance is a barrier please reach out.
****************
Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.
Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.

Photo credit: Image by pikisuperstar on Freepik

events.id:
We
Mac 'n' Cheese pop-up! Kaibosh X Everybody Eats collab for Welly On A Plate-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name:
We
Mac 'n' Cheese pop-up! Kaibosh X Everybody Eats collab for Welly On A Plate
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We
Mac 'n' Cheese! A feast with purpose, where every bowl makes a difference. Celebrate the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate and the end of winter with the ultimate comfort food: mac 'n' cheese, served all day long.
At just $10 per serve, every bowl will help raise funds for Everybody Eats and Kaibosh - two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions. Help us hit our target of 2,000 bowls in one day!
WHEN: Sunday 31 August, 1-8pm (or sold out)
WHERE: 60 Dixon Street (upstairs)
COST: $10 per bowl (pay-what-you-can options available).
Walk-in only, dine-in or takeaway.
Vegan and Gluten Free options available.
Bring your friends, whānau, or the whole flat!
You'll be able to customise your mac 'n' cheese with a range of toppings and flavours which have been made with rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. From rainbow pickles to herby crunchy crumb, extra #FoodRescue flavour bombs to spice up your mac!
As official charity partners of the Wellington On A Plate Festival, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh turn comfort food into real impact for our communities.
We
kai. We
Welly.
Share your
with Welly.
Pay-it-forward to help us share hearty kai with more people in Pōneke: https://donorbox.org/welovemacncheese-donation
Thank you to Fonterra's Doing Good Together programme, PAK'nSAVE Kilbirnie, Harrington's and All Good for supporting us with this event which is a joint fundraiser for our two charities.
The goal on 31 August is to serve 2,000 bowls AND to also fund 2,000 meals for the community. Join the celebration, enjoy incredible kai and help make a real difference.

events.description:
This new 6-week block of classes is a wonderful way to get into jewellery-making or advance your skills!
It runs for 6 weeks from Sunday 31 August to Sunday 5 October, 2pm - 5pm.
Our classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.
It's a great way to add colour and texture to your metalwork without adding in gemstones.
Beginners will start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.

events.id: ELIXIR CLOSING Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition VII x WCC x Diplomatico Rum-8 Chews Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: ELIXIR CLOSING Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition VII x WCC x Diplomatico Rum
events.venue: 8 Chews Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
𝐈𝐭’𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐬 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐚 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐠.
For the SEVENTH consecutive year, we're bringing back our legendary Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition and YOU are all invited!
Calling all movers, shakers, and daiquiri dream-makers: your mission is simple…
Make the best daiquiri. While blindfolded. In 60 seconds. In front of a crowd. No pressure.
After almost four years of shaking, stirring, caffeinating, feeding, and occasionally corrupting Wellington, Elixir Cocktail Apotheke is throwing a glorious, FINAL 𝐁𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐅𝐎𝐋𝐃𝐄𝐃 𝐃𝐀𝐈𝐐𝐔𝐈𝐑𝐈 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐏𝐄𝐓𝐈𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 before we ride off into the cocktail sunset.
This year, we are pairing up with 𝐃𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐨 𝐑𝐮𝐦, courtesy of 𝐇𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 AND the 𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛
https://www.facebook.com/groups/246872129390986
Competitors will be given four mystery spirits, juices, and sugars in unmarked bottles, pick their fight song, then step up and shake like the future of cocktails depends on it.
Expect some Elixir closing-party nonsense: specials galore, questionable games, family pricing, and memories to last.
There’ll be laughter, probably some tears, and definitely some questionable dance moves. This is our last hurrah — one more night to raise a glass, hail Satan, and make some chaos together.
𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚𝐧 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐬
𝐖𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐭, 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐬𝐨 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚 𝐠𝐨𝐝𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐧 𝐜𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞.
𝑭𝒆𝒓𝒏𝒆𝒕 𝒊𝒔 𝒃𝒊𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓,
𝑪𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒂𝒐 𝒎𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕 𝒃𝒆 𝒃𝒍𝒖𝒆,
𝑾𝒆'𝒓𝒆 𝒉𝒚𝒑𝒆𝒅 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒏𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕

events.id: It's in the Ballot - WCC - Pukehīnau/Lambton Ward -In-studio-Queen Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region 5014-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - WCC - Pukehīnau/Lambton Ward -In-studio
events.venue: Queen Street Lower Hutt, Wellington Region 5014
events.long_description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.description:
IAS Cushion Concerts presents local bands in the intimate environment of historic Inverlochy House.
This August join us for 'songs of road trips, relationships and reality tv' with Buffalo, Buffalo, Buffalo.
This seven-piece herd of instrument addicts play a mix of electronic and acoustic to produce pop-rock that is equal parts playful, whimsical and catchy.

events.id: Nota Bene and The Bach Choir of Wellington - Quiz Night-1852 Pub & Kitchen, 55 Cleveland St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nota Bene and The Bach Choir of Wellington - Quiz Night
events.venue: 1852 Pub & Kitchen, 55 Cleveland St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Nota Bene and The Bach Choir combine for a quiz night fundraiser to be held at the 1852 pub in Brooklyn on Sunday 31st August .

Please, invite friends, form winning teams in advance but remember you can also just build a team on the night with unaligned quizzers. Such randomly formed teams are great fun and have won on previous occasions.

The Quiz proper starts at 7pm but you can also have dinner there from 5pm by calling 1852 in advance and making a booking (04 801 9544)

This is the first opportuity for the two choir collaboration, and our Chamber orchestra Chiesa Ensemble to get together as we start rehearals leading to a performance of the masterwork, Weihnachts Oratorium (Bachs's XMAS Oratorio).

That concert will happen at 7pm on the 15th of November at St Mary of the Angels.

events.id: Paediatrics: Daytime Mobility & Function + Practical Workshop (Nelson)- Saxton Road, Stoke, Nelson Nelson, Nelson Region-Event Brite
events.name: Paediatrics: Daytime Mobility & Function + Practical Workshop (Nelson)
events.venue: Saxton Road, Stoke, Nelson Nelson, Nelson Region
events.description:
Powerchair Academy Nelson - Venue to be announced _____________________________________________________________________________________________ Overview: Join us for an engaging and interactive session focused on paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) and safe car seat solutions!
We’ll explore prescribing AT for sitting, standing, stepping, and mobility—blending clinical theory with real-world insights on equipment choices.
Engage in a hands-on practical session to test techniques, plus learn how to collaborate with parents, caregivers, and kids for practical, daily-use solutions, including safe transportation.
Learning Objectives Identify and describe different types of paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) equipment Explain the clinical rationale behind equipment prescription Enhance collaboration with families and caregivers Assess the functional needs of children and recommend suitable AT solutions About our Presentor: Jamie's Bio: BSc Physiotheraop, Paediatric Product Education - Medifab Jamie Cockle is a trained physiotherapist and Medifab's Paediatric Clinical Educator and Seating and Positioning Specialist.
With a passion for empowering therapists, product specialists, and families, Jamie provides expert training on Medifab’s paediatric equipment, ensuring practical knowledge that can be applied every day to optimise children’s health and happiness.

events.id: The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.

Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa.
The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow.

events.description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg, and Emma Barnes Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling and taut with intellectual curiosity.
Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (if we knew how to we would) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, and how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heartbreak and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.

events.id: Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami-55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami
events.venue: 55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In lecture theatre 2 (GBLT2) in the Law School at Victoria University / Te Herenga Waka.
Ramsey Library presents a public lecture by Bradford Haami.
What happens when vastly different ways of being meet? Dame Anne Salmond writes of ‘competing cosmologies’ and ‘ontological collisions’ — European missionaries arriving in Aotearoa in the early 19th century brought a Biblical cosmology that began such a collision. In this public lecture Bradford Haami will explore the interactions between Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual worldviews that continue to evolve up to the present.
* How do Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual beliefs and thought relate?
* How 19th century rangatira negotiate between traditional beliefs and the Biblical narratives?
* Where do Christian and Māori ways of knowing and seeing clash, compete or enrich each other?
* What does being Māori and Christian look like today?

Bradford Haami (Ngāti Awa) is a Māori historian, researcher and author with research interests in Māori worldviews, spirituality, Christianity and cultural preservation. He is Pou Amorangi (Māori Director) at Laidlaw College in Auckland, New Zealand, where he lectures in biculturalism and sits on the governing board of the college. Haami has written several books on Māori history, culture and spirituality, with recent works including Urban Māori: The Second Great Migration (Oratia Media 2018) and Bringing Culture into Care (Huia 2019). He was the Māori curator/expert on the acclaimed Te Taiao / Nature exhibition at Te Papa Tongarewa Museum.
--
To browse the Ramsey Library catalogue, and sign up to borrow books (free), go to https://library.chaplaincyvuw.org.nz

events.id: Botany Tours for Conservation Week at Te Papa-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Botany Tours for Conservation Week at Te Papa
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come behind the scenes to visit the Botany collection which houses more than 300,000 plant specimens collected in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.
There are two tours available:
Tuesday 2nd September BOH 11.30 – 12.30pm
Thursday 4th September BOH 3.30 – 4.30PM
You will find out how we store and take care of these valuable collections, and the research they support. There will be a chance to see our precious botanical taonga, including botanical specimens and art, and have a closer look at the very first plants collected by the European naturalists Joseph Banks and Daniel Solander over 250 years ago during Captain James Cook’s first voyage to New Zealand.

events.id: Women in finance lunch, with speaker Christina Leung, CFA- Lambton Quay Wellington, North Island-Event Brite
events.name: Women in finance lunch, with speaker Christina Leung, CFA
events.venue: Lambton Quay Wellington, North Island
events.long_description:
Welcome to the Women in Finance Lunch event! Join us for an inspiring talk by Christina Leung, CFA at Forsyth Barr. This in-person event will bring together women in the finance industry to network, learn, and empower each other. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from a successful professional and connect with like-minded individuals. Reserve your spot now!
We're pleased to invite our members and CFA candidates to another Women in Finance lunch, this time with guest speaker; CFA charterholder, Christina Leung, CFA, Deputy Chief Executive & Principal Economist, NZIER
About our presenter
Christina Leung, CFA is Vice Chair of the CFA Society New Zealand and Deputy Chief Executive (Auckland) and Principal Economist at the NZ Institute of Economic Research (NZIER), where she looks after economic forecasts and analysis of the Quarterly Survey of Business Opinion. Christina also works with many clients looking at topical issues, including the wider economic impact of particular industries and investments. She previously worked at the Reserve Bank of New Zealand and ASB. Christina holds a Bachelor of Commerce with first class honours in Economics.
Christina will talk about her career journey and share her experiences of being a woman in the world of economics and finance.
Bring a friend
We invite members and candidates to bring along a colleague, please register for catering purposes.
Men are very welcome too!
As with previous events, we understand you're busy. It's okay to arrive late, or leave early, we'd just like to see you.
Many thanks to Forsyth Barr for hosting this event.

events.description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

events.id: Wellington Climate Fresk Workshop-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Climate Fresk Workshop
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Do you want to be part of the solution to tackle climate change but don’t have the time to become a climate scientist? Join us for a 3-hour interactive workshop to explore the causes and consequences of climate disturbances.
Based on the IPCC report and played by over 2 million people worldwide, this collaborative workshop allows you to understand the key issues of climate change to empower you to take action.
How it works:
The workshop is based on a 42-card game. Each card represents an element, a cause or a consequence of climate change.
In teams, guided by your facilitator, you are encouraged to find the cause-effect relationship between the different components of climate change. Collective intelligence will get you from one deck of card to the next!
This step-by-step reconstruction provides keys to understand the complexity and develop an overview of climate change.
Agenda:
Introduction, 15 mins
Fresk Card Game, 1 1/2 hours
Debrief and Actions, 1 hour 15 mins
Climate Fresk is an excellent opportunity to understand the key elements of climate change and what you can do to be part of the solution. No previous climate knowledge is needed.

Tea, coffee and snacks will be served during the short break. Workshop run by Climate Training Co. Ltd. Donations welcome!

In teams, guided by your facilitator, you are encouraged to find the cause-effect relationship between the different components of climate change.

events.id: Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time-Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time
events.venue: Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region
events.long_description:
Event Information
Some days remind us who we are and where we come from — when an entire nation moves as one to honour Independence.
To celebrate the 80th Anniversary of Vietnam’s National Day (2 September), Viet Hub NZ proudly presents
“Echoes of Home – A Musical Across Time”
This free concert is a heartfelt journey through the sounds of Vietnamese history — from nostalgic childhood songs to powerful wartime ballads and modern melodies of pride and hope. All performances will include English subtitles, making it easy for everyone to follow along and connect with the stories.
Whether you’re Vietnamese or simply curious about a different culture, this is a wonderful opportunity to experience the warmth, resilience, and beauty of Vietnam through music and storytelling.
🎁 Raffle with Over $300 in Prizes
Don’t miss our special raffle on the day. Tickets will be available at the venue for $5 and $10. Payment can be made in cash or by bank transfer.
💛 Support Viet Hub NZ
This event is free to attend, but if you believe in what we do and want to help us continue running community workshops, cultural events, and youth-led initiatives — please consider making a donation.
👉 Donate here: https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/viet-hub-nz-rooted-in-culture-powered-by-community
Your koha helps keep our work going, rooted in culture, powered by community.

In celebration of 80 years of Vietnam’s National Day (2/9), join us for a powerful evening of music, memory, and connection.
Through traditional and contemporary Vietnamese songs, Echoes of Home takes you on a heartfelt journey — honouring the past, embracing the present, and looking to the future. events.id: Book Group: Heart of A Dog By Mikhail Bulgakov-The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Book Group: Heart of A Dog By Mikhail Bulgakov
events.venue: The Library, 1/53 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Classic Literature Group meets on the first Tuesday of the month. We read novels that have stood the test of time, whether they were written in 1780, 1880 or even 1980. It's a public group so feel free to come along when it suits.

Our September book is Heart of a Dog (or A Dog's Heart), a 1925 novel by Mikhail Bulgakov, described as a biting satire of Bolshevism. The book wasn't officially published in the Soviet Union until 1987.

Our group very much enjoyed Bulgakov's masterpiece The Master and Margarita back in 2018, so looking forward to reading another of his works...

VENUE
We meet in the ‘Games Room’, The Library bar's private area overlooking Courtenay Place. After you enter the bar, head to your right (up the step) and through a smaller space with booths to the large carpeted space beyond.

events.id: Cooking: Gourmet Sausage Making-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Cooking: Gourmet Sausage Making
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cooking: Gourmet Sausage Making Come along and learn how to fill sausage casings with a tasty mincemeat and get tips and tricks on how to make your own customized sausage mixes at home with the use of various herbs and spices.
Everyone will get some sausages to take home and enjoy.
All ingredients included in course fee but please bring your apron, a dish cloth and a couple of tea towels to the session.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: -  Recognise how to handle a knife safely -  Understand food safety and hygiene around sausage-making and avoiding cross contamination -  Recognise the difference between two kinds of sausage casings and why you use each of them -  Have some ideas on how to make and cook a good quality sausage properly -  Be able to safely store sausages products Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.
We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly.

events.id: Paediatrics: Daytime Mobility & Function + Practical Workshop (Wellington)- Stewart Duff Drive Wellington, Wellington Region-Event Brite
events.name: Paediatrics: Daytime Mobility & Function + Practical Workshop (Wellington)
events.venue: Stewart Duff Drive Wellington, Wellington Region
events.long_description:
Paediatric Academy Wellington - Venue to be announced
_____________________________________________________________________________________________
Overview:
Join us for an engaging and interactive session focused on paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) and safe car seat solutions! We’ll explore prescribing AT for sitting, standing, stepping, and mobility—blending clinical theory with real-world insights on equipment choices.
Engage in a hands-on practical session to test techniques, plus learn how to collaborate with parents, caregivers, and kids for practical, daily-use solutions, including safe transportation. Don’t miss this chance to boost your skills and confidence!
Learning Objectives
Identify and describe different types of paediatric Assistive Technology (AT) equipment
Explain the clinical rationale behind equipment prescription
Enhance collaboration with families and caregivers
Assess the functional needs of children and recommend suitable AT solutions
About our Presentor:
Jamie's Bio:
BSc Physiotheraop, Paediatric Product Education - Medifab
Jamie Cockle is a trained physiotherapist and Medifab's Paediatric Clinical Educator and Seating and Positioning Specialist. With a passion for empowering therapists, product specialists, and families, Jamie provides expert training on Medifab’s paediatric equipment, ensuring practical knowledge that can be applied every day to optimise children’s health and happiness.
Jamie’s career began as a Paediatric Physiotherapist at Noah’s Ark Children’s Hospital in Cardiff, followed by a role at Bristol Royal Hospital for Children. It was in these settings that he developed his expertise in paediatric equipment, particularly for children with neurological conditions. He is driven by the belief that every child should have access to the right support, regardless of their abilities or diagnosis..

events.id: Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano-St Marks Church Lower Hutt, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano
events.venue: St Marks Church Lower Hutt, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Leo Smit - Divertimento

Ginastera - No. 2 from Danzas Argentinas, op. 2 - "Danza de la moza donosa"

Ravel - Sonatine, M. 40, Movement I - Modéré

Schubert - "Lebensstürme," Allegro in A minor, D 947

Amanda Bunting is a graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, completing her Bachelor of Music with Honours in 2019 in solo piano performance with Dr. Jian Liu; small group ensemble with Dr. Rolf Gjelsten; and performance and embodiment studies with Dr. Hamish Robb and Dr. Margaret Medlyn. Prior to that, she completed a Graduate Diploma in Music in performance piano, performance studies, and pedagogy.

After previously studying with Gillian Bibby at the Conservatorium of Music and graduating in 1996, Amanda chose to return to study to further develop performance skills, enhance her own piano performance abilities and to gain further knowledge that can be shared with her piano students. Amanda is an Associate of the Institute of Registered Music Teachers New Zealand, a member of the Wellington Branch and currently works both as a Piano Teacher and a Human Resources Adviser at Victoria University of Wellington.

Kris Zuelicke grew up in a theatrical and musical family, accompanying shows and choirs from high school onwards. In the USA, she gained degrees in Music (BA Miami University) and Music Theory (MA Indiana University) and taught music along with other subjects at the Bloomington Montessori School.

In Karlsruhe, Germany Kris taught at the Landau Montessori School, Berlitz Language School, courses on theatre and music at the Teacher’s College and piano privately. She studied with Annemi Egri and Sariel Maler during this time.

Kris currently teaches in five schools around Wellington, maintains a thriving private piano and cello studio and accompanies students at the New Zealand School of Music. Her most recent degree is in harpsichord performance (DMA NZSM), including study and research in Boston with Mark Kroll. Kris enjoys performing regularly with other musicians, including piano duets, chamber music and has enjoyed projects with Stroma, the Queen’s Closet and a fun stint as a harpsichordist extra in the recently released Time Bandits.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - TDC – Eketahuna Community Board - In-studio- Haswell Street Eketāhuna, Manawatū-Whanganui Region-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - TDC – Eketahuna Community Board - In-studio
events.venue: Haswell Street Eketāhuna, Manawatū-Whanganui Region
events.long_description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.id: Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture 2025 | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington-111 Wakefield Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture 2025 | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington
events.venue: 111 Wakefield Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.long_description:
Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects are excited to welcome Ian Moore to New Zealand to present this year’s lecture series ‘The Past Needs a Future’ which will focus on adaptive reuse.
Ian is the principal of Ian Moore Architects, established in 1990. The practice has won numerous Australian and international awards and has been published and exhibited widely, including at the Venice Architecture Biennale in 2008 and 2012.
Initially studying civil and structural engineering at the Auckland Technical Institute in New Zealand, Ian moved on to study architecture at the University of Technology, Sydney, graduating with honours in 1988.
Ian has taught at numerous universities and been a speaker and guest lecturer throughout Australia as well as internationally.
Ian has also been a member of awards juries in Australia, New Zealand and at the World Festival of Interiors in 2013 and the World Architecture Festival in 2015. In 2003, Ian was the inaugural Creative Director for the Australian Institute of Architects annual conference.
About the Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture
The annual Sir Ian Athfield Memorial Lecture commemorates the late Ian Athfield, a singular and much-loved figure in New Zealand architecture.
Affectionately known as ‘Ath’, Ian was knighted in 2014 and was one of New Zealand’s most influential architects. He won more than 60 national and international architecture and design awards and the lecture series was established to honour his legacy and celebrate his larrikin spirit.
In keeping with that spirit, each year the lecture is given by a person with something to say – someone who is challenging orthodoxy and a business-as-usual approach to practice, and life.
During his career, Ath designed many significant buildings, none more so than his own home in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, which enraged the neighbours, perplexed the Council and inspired the city for decades.
Ath was talented, original, insightful, opinionated, provocative, and sometimes outrageous. His architecture is stimulating, challenging, ever-changing, but never careless.
In 2004, Te Kāhui Whaihanga New Zealand Institute of Architects awarded Ath the Gold Medal for career achievements, noting at the time “What defines Athfield above all is his contagious enthusiasm, his devotion to architecture, and his unswerving belief in its possibilities. Believing architecture to be a civilising force, he has demonstrated a strong commitment to architecture’s public realm: the streets we live in; the urban centres we inhabit; the countryside we love and so often abuse.”
The Sir Ian Athfield Lecture Series is proudly sponsored by Resene and GIB.
CPD points: 10
TIMING:
Doors open: 5.00pm
Lecture: 5.30pm - 6.30pm
Q&A: 6.30pm - 7.00pm
LECTURE DATES:
Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington | Wednesday 3 September | Michael Fowler Centre
Tāhuna Queenstown | Friday 5 September | Crowne Plaza
Whakatū Nelson | Tuesday 9 September | The Suter - Te Aratoi o Whakatū
Ōtautahi Christchurch | Wednesday 10 September | Black Box Theatre - Papa Hou
Heretaunga Hastings | Thursday 11 September | Toi Toi
Ngāmotu New Plymouth | Monday 15 September | Novotel
Kirikiriroa Hamilton | Tuesday 16 September | Bill Gallagher Centre
Tāmaki Makaurua Auckland | Thursday 18 September | TBC

events.id: Putin’s Russia and Southeast Asia: The Kremlin’s Pivot to Asia and the Impact of the Russia-Ukraine War-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Putin’s Russia and Southeast Asia: The Kremlin’s Pivot to Asia and the Impact of the Russia-Ukraine War
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Dr Ian Storey will discuss his new book on Russia’s relations with Southeast Asia. The first major study of Russia and Southeast Asia since the end of the Cold War, it traces the dramatic shifts in Moscow’s relations with the region since President Vladimir Putin took power in 2000. Dr Storey assesses the legacy of the Soviet Union, charts the evolution of Putin’s foreign policy and identifies the drivers behind the Kremlin’s ‘Turn to the East’ or Asia pivot. His book also examines Russia’s dialogue partnership with the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) and the development of Moscow’s political, economic and military ties with each of the 11 regional states over the past 25 years. A large part of the book is devoted to Southeast Asia’s responses to Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. At the end of the talk Dr Storey will also provide an update of Russia-Southeast Asia relations in 2025 and how the region views the on-going Russia-Ukraine War.
Dr Ian Storey is a Senior Fellow at the ISEAS-Yusof Ishak Institute, Singapore. He specializes in regional security issues, focusing on Southeast Asia’s relations with the major powers and maritime security, especially the South China Sea dispute. Since joining ISEAS in 2007 he has been the editor of the ISEAS academic journal Contemporary Southeast Asia. Prior to ISEAS, Ian held academic positions at the Asia-Pacific Center for Security Studies, Hawaii and at Deakin University, Australia. Ian received his PhD from the City University of Hong Kong, his Master’s degree from the International University of Japan and his BA (Hons) from the University of Hull, England. He is the author of Putin’s Russia and Southeast Asia: The Kremlin’s Pivot to Asia and the Impact of the Russia-Ukraine War (2025) and Southeast Asia and the Rise of China: The Search for Security (2011)

The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.

Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.

events.id: The Racket Lounge: Session Three-Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Racket Lounge: Session Three
events.venue: Bedlam and Squalor, Upstairs, 18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.

events.id: Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene-Mean Doses Taproom, Level 1, 66 Tory St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene
events.venue: Mean Doses Taproom, Level 1, 66 Tory St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

events.id: Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.


When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.

events.id: Community Planting Belmont Regional Park-Belmont Regional Park, Waitangirua, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Community Planting Belmont Regional Park
events.venue: Belmont Regional Park, Waitangirua, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
Help us reforest the hills of Belmont Regional Park. By planting native trees and shrubs, we will restore the native ngahere/forests and create an ecological corridor for wildlife to travel between Wellington, Porirua, Kāpiti and the Hutt Valley.

We have partnered with GWRC, PCC, and local iwi to restore the hills of Belmont Park. Starting on the west hillside, our aim this year is to plant 5,000 native plants to create a forest for the future! This project aims to bring the community together to restore the hillsides of the Belmont Regional Park.

We provide all the tools and training, no prior experience needed. We can even provide transport to the site. Just bring your energy and lunch. We will provide you with a yummy morning tea.

Come have some fun planting with us and TAKE ACTION FOR NATURE!

This event is part of Conservation Week 2025 - www.doc.govt.nz/conservationweek

Sign up for this event on our website ConservationVolunteers.co.nz or email Wellington@cvnz.org.nz

events.id: Integrating Creative Writing Into Painting - 4 Week Course-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Integrating Creative Writing Into Painting - 4 Week Course
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Creative writing and painting are both powerful forms of artistic expression. By integrating creative writing into your painting practice, you can enhance your imagination, storytelling abilities, emotional expression, attention to detail, and personal style on the canvas. Please bring along a journal or laptop.

COURSE CONTENT
Each session presents a key idea backed by research or concrete examples, followed by practical writing exercises with optional sharing. We learn by doing and from each other.

1. Generating work from the interior: tapping into memories, conflict, emotion, and observation to generate art.
2. Figuring out what matters to you, then learning how to grow your fragmented ideas into something whole. For example, how do you turn a feeling, or a fleeting moment in time into a story? Into a painting? Into a work of art? What are the building blocks you need?
3. Inspiration from other creative sources: people, music, poetry, reading, random incidents. Ways to generate fresh ideas. How to clarify and focus in writing and art.
4. Structure and boundaries. Dreaming big but being real. How do you find and stick to a creative process? Understanding how you learn and what kind of feedback you need. Designing your next project.

Thursday mornings, 9:30 - 11:45 am.
4 - 25 September.
events.description:
By integrating creative writing into your painting practice, you can enhance your imagination, storytelling abilities, emotional expression, attention to detail, and personal style on the canvas.
We learn by doing and from each other.
Figuring out what matters to you, then learning how to grow your fragmented ideas into something whole.
Into a painting?
How to clarify and focus in writing and art.

events.id: Site Visit - Holcim Readymix Wellington-121 Centennial Highway, Ngauranga Gorge, Wellington 6035, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Site Visit - Holcim Readymix Wellington
events.venue: 121 Centennial Highway, Ngauranga Gorge, Wellington 6035, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ever wondered how concrete is made?
Join us on Thursday 4th September, for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site tour of the Holcim Readymix NZ plant. Grab a behind the scenes look at:
 🏗️ The Process: How raw materials like cement, aggregates & water are mixed to create concrete
⚙️ Batching & Mixing: How mix designs are selected and adjusted
📏 Quality: Quality controls & production oversight, including testing & slumping
🚚 Dispatch:  Loading, scheduling & delivery coordination
🌱 Sustainability: Low carbon products and how Holcim is approaching driving a circular economy
 The Details:
🕒 DATE and TIME: Thursday, 4th September, 1pm
📍 LOCATION: 121 Centennial Highway, Ngauranga Gorge
🚗PARKING: Parking is tricky! Please carpool if possible, limited parking is available at the front of the Holcim offices (2 car parks) and one more at the top car park. Alternatively, bus route #1 stops off at Ngauranga Gorge (Kiwi Point) stop and is a short walk away
🎟️ COST: Free to NAWIC members, with a maximum of 10 people on the tour, so please book your space consciously. Get in quick! You can join NAWIC here.
👷‍♀️PPE: Hard hat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots, glasses (Spare hard-hats/hi-vis are available if required, please make sure you advise us of what you need on your RSVP.)
 ABOUT HOLCIM: Holcim is a global company across Europe, Asia, Pacific, Latin America, Middle East and Africa.  Holcim NZ  is a leading supplier of cement, aggregates and ready-mix concrete in New Zealand dating back to 1888. You may have noticed their big silos on the Centre Port (near the Interislander). Holcim have a network of plants throughout New Zealand, and one of their main missions is around sustainability, where they actively promote low-carbon concrete solutions, including their premium range ECOPact ECOplanet.
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

events.id: Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order-28 Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region 6012-Event Brite
events.name: Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order
events.venue: 28 Kelburn Parade Wellington, Wellington Region 6012
events.long_description:
Abstract
Over the last decade, China has punished countries that undermine its territorial claims and foreign policy goals with measures such as restricting trade, encouraging popular boycotts, and cutting off tourism. These coercive measures have caused significant economic damage to U.S. partners such as Japan, the Philippines, Taiwan, and Australia. This talk focuses on Taiwan’s response to China’s economic sanctions, highlighting the agency of medium-sized countries in the shadow of a great power.
The second part of this presentation will propose a common understanding of the liberal international order in which state and non-state actors follow rules, norms, and legal procedures in conducting international affairs. This rule-based practice is an essential part of the Asian regional order. If Taiwan were integrated into the multilateral institutions in Asia, the chance of conflict would be greatly reduced. The future of Taiwan also depends on the resilience of the liberal international order and other middle-power states in the Asia Pacific.
Bio
Christina Lai is an Associate Research Fellow in the Institute of Political Science at Academia Sinica, Taiwan. Dr. Lai received her Ph.D. in Government from Georgetown University. In 2015-2016, she was a post-doctoral fellow in China and the World Program at Princeton University. She is interested in U.S.-China-Taiwan Relations, Chinese Foreign Policy, East Asian politics, and Qualitative Research Methods. Her works have appeared in the Politics, International Politics, Political Science, PS: Political Science & Politics, Journal of Contemporary China, Pacific Review, and Asian Security.
events.description:
Abstract Over the last decade, China has punished countries that undermine its territorial claims and foreign policy goals with measures such as restricting trade, encouraging popular boycotts, and cutting off tourism.
These coercive measures have caused significant economic damage to U.S. partners such as Japan, the Philippines, Taiwan, and Australia.
The second part of this presentation will propose a common understanding of the liberal international order in which state and non-state actors follow rules, norms, and legal procedures in conducting international affairs.
Bio Christina Lai is an Associate Research Fellow in the Institute of Political Science at Academia Sinica, Taiwan.
Her works have appeared in the Politics, International Politics, Political Science, PS: Political Science & Politics, Journal of Contemporary China, Pacific Review, and Asian Security.

events.id: Strengths & Superpowers-Level 22, NTT Tower 157 Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Strengths & Superpowers
events.venue: Level 22, NTT Tower 157 Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.long_description:
Strengths & Superpowers
Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest.
Welcome to the second conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
This conversation is led by two experts who are empowering other women, and will focus on an often-overlooked asset: personal branding. Whether your sights are set on a project or a promotion, this powerful tool can put you on the radar for the opportunities you want.
Why be part of this conversation?
When you control your narrative, you can ensure that it's accurate, compelling, and unique. Join our interactive session to uncover and learn how to convey the unique value you bring to the table. It isn't about crafting a fake persona, it's about making sure your superpowers get noticed.
You’ll get expert insights into:
Strengths: Understand and use your strengths for impact.
Superpower: Take control of what you want to be known for.
Story: Quick ways to naturally share your value.
Who’s the speaker?
Natalie Ferguson & Kristen Luman are the founders of Powrsuit - a career accelerator for every woman that takes professional development out of to-do lists and into weekly routines. With over 700 members across NZ, Australia, North America and Singapore, Powrsuit's research-backed approach delivers a tangible return on investment. After six months, 82% of members increase self-leadership skills, and 28% take a tangible step forward in their careers.
This interactive workshop is a must-attend for anyone who wants to maximise their visibility and value, regardless of job title.
**All attendees will go into the draw to win a annual Powrsuit membership**
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Powrsuit mini-masterclass
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Business card prize draw:
Attend the event and go in the draw to win a “New BMW for a Weekend” and a “New MINI for a Weekend” from Continental Cars BMW and Wellington MINI Garage.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
18 September: Impactful Leadership - What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.

events.id: Book Launch: Rangatiratanga & Gentlemanship: A Conversation in 1825 by Grant Hodgson-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Book Launch: Rangatiratanga & Gentlemanship: A Conversation in 1825 by Grant Hodgson
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us in the shop to celebrate the launch of Rangatiratanga & Gentlemanship: A conversation in 1825 by Grant Hodgson published by Writes Hill Press.
“From the great sedimentary layers of historical documents on New Zealand’s colonisation, Hodgson has extracted a nugget that reveals so much about the nature of interactions between Māori and Pākehā in the earliest stages of settlement. With great insight, this short work illuminates the significance of this period of contact.” ~ Professor Paul Moon ONZM, historian
This book examines a rare piece of evidence illustrating the initial conditions of the relation­ship between Māori and missionaries at Kerikeri in 1825.
All welcome!

events.id: Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Tusiata Avia-Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Kotahitanga: Artist Series - Tusiata Avia
events.venue: Wellington Museum, 3 Jervois Quay, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
We are honoured to host acclaimed poet; Tusiata Avia who will be opening Kotahitanga with her response to He Kura Toi Tangata.

Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.

5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends



About Tusiata Avia

Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.

Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.


This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.

events.id: Sound Healing Experience-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sound Healing Experience
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio Escutia

It’ll be a transcendent evening of Sacred Harmonic Sounds, where multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia will guide you through a deeply restorative sonic experience. Plus - there will be an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert included in your ticket!

Let the vibrations of Gongs, Crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other ancient instruments wash over you—melting away tension, quieting the mind, and opening a doorway to inner stillness.

With Claudio’s masterful soundscapes, you’ll not only hear the music but feel it resonating through your body, inviting profound relaxation and a reconnection to your heart. No prior meditation or yoga experience is needed—just come as you are and let the sound carry you into a space of deep peace.

What to Bring?
Yoga mats, blankets & cushions are provided but you are also welcome to bring your own yoga mat and any extra cushions or any other comforts for the ultimate experience!

Why You Won’t Want to Miss This


A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound

A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal


Limited spaces

Meet Claudio Escutia, your host
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.

Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:

SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

events.id: The Last Sky Film Screening-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Last Sky Film Screening
events.venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about The Last Sky, screening on the 4th of September can be found at https://www.thelastskyfilm.com/.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton District Mayoral Debate -In-studio-117 Chester Rd, Clareville, Carterton Clareville, Wellington Region 5791-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton District Mayoral Debate -In-studio
events.venue: 117 Chester Rd, Clareville, Carterton Clareville, Wellington Region 5791
events.long_description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.venue: Level 8, 54 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
This is not your grandma’s bingo night. Wellington’s resident sad boy and pint-sized powerhouse, Homer Neurotic, is taking over the rooftop at Dirty Little Secret for a night of unhinged chaos, cocktails, and camp realness.
Get ready for an evening dripping in glamour, glitter, and glorious nonsense as you soak up the skyline views from one of the capital’s most iconic rooftop hideaways.
What to expect:
• Free entry, all you need is a table booking and good vibes
• Over $200 worth of prizes, including a $100 bar voucher for the grand winner
• Spot prizes, cheeky antics, and bad decisions encouraged
• Live drag performances that’ll leave you confused, flustered, and deeply entertained
• Dad jokes, dance-offs, and plenty of double entendres
• Drink and kai specials to keep you going
• After the Bingo stick around to boogie down with one of the resident DJ’s, spinning your tracks all night long
Bookings essential:
Tables available from 7.00 pm with balls dropping no later than 7.30. Walk-ins are very limited so grab your spot now:
https://dirtylittlesecret.co.nz/events/drag-bingo/
Safe and inclusive:
Dirty Little Secret is proudly LGBTQIA+ friendly. Our staff and security are trained to make everyone feel welcome and safe. Elevator access is available, but some tables are on raised flooring, so please reach out if you have accessibility needs and we’ll make sure you’re well looked after.
Heads up:
This is an R18 event. Expect colourful language, cheeky antics, and wholesome masculinity served with a side of mischief. Consider yourself warned.
Follow me for more nonsense:
Find me on Instagram at @homerneurotic for a peek behind the scenes and more of the drama, glitter and tears.

events.id: A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?-331 Suffolk Road Nelson, Nelson 7011-Event Brite
events.name: A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?
events.venue: 331 Suffolk Road Nelson, Nelson 7011
events.long_description:
Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson
